Este es su cuarto ciclo en Afodenic el cual da las gracias por los beneficios que ha mejorado para su familia. Sus metas es seguir dando su servicio de trabajo a la policía nacional y al país, para poder reducir la delincuencia y el abuso a los nicaragüenses.
texts.en:
Ana Rosa is a public official with the National Police. For 15 years, as a singe mother, she has worked hard to take care of her family. Rosa lives with her grown daughter, who also helps her. Rosa is 52 years old and lives in Neighborhood 380 in Managua. The loan she is requesting will be used to refurbish her home by purchasing ceiling beams and zinc sheeting to replace her roof, which is in poor condition. This is Rosa's fourth loan from [Kiva partner] Afodenic. Rosa is thankful for Afodenic for the benefits her family has received. Rosa's goal is to continue serving the National Police and her country with the aim of reducing crime and abuse of Nicaraguan citizens.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ceiling beams and zinc sheeting to replace the roof of her house

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en: Mrs. Esterlina O., a 63-year-old mother of six, lives in Dulapo, Oroquieta City. Being a single parent is not easy for her, but she finds ways and means to survive. While she engages in buy and sell activities, she recently ventured into flower-selling, and with the help of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, she has thus far been able to sustain the business. Today, she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy additional ornamental plants & fertilizers. Having good health is what she prays for always, and in the future she wants to own a flower shop.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for ornamental plants & other flowers for sale.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel es una mujer que ha luchado mucho para sobresalir en la vida, a sus 37 años vive en la casa de sus familiares y lo que más desea es tener un futuro mejor. Cuando dejó su natal Ilave (Distrito de Puno), y decidió que haría de todo para sobresalir en la vida, actualmente trae desde Oruro (ciudad de Bolivia) materiales ferreteros porque le salen más baratos y los distribuye en las ferreterías de la ciudad de Puno a un muy buen precio, lo que hace que tenga mucha demanda. Isabel disfruta de salir a distribuir los materiales de construcción, ya que le da la libertad de recorrer la ciudad libremente, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil es traer la mercadería desde tan lejos, puesto que le resulta cansado. Para el futuro anhela tener su propia tienda donde pueda vender ella misma los materiales que trae. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y se siente muy feliz de haberlo obtenido, tiene muchas ganas de pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy querida y respetada. Con los 1700 nuevos soles solicitados planea incrementar su capital de trabajo, para comprar más materiales.
texts.en:
Isabel is a woman who has always struggled hard to excel. At 37 years old, she lives in a house with her family and what she most wants is to have a better future. When she left her hometown, she decided that she would do all she could to improve her life, and today she buys hardware supplies at low prices in Oruro and sells them in hardware stores in the city of Puno at a very good price, which drives up demand. Isabel enjoys distributing construction materials, since it gives her the freedom to travel around the city freely. She has been doing this for 4 years, and the most difficult part is transporting her goods long distances since it is so tiring. In the future, she hopes to have her own store where she herself can sell the merchandise that she purchases. This is the second loan she has solicited from MFO, and she is very happy to have received the first one. She looks forward to making her payments on time, and in her community bank she is loved and respected. With the 1700 Sols she plans to increase her investment capital in order to buy more materials.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Lani

texts.en: Lani E. is 42 years old and married to Antonio, a civil engineer. They are blessed with three children; all are studying. Lani was already  business-minded before she became a member of Paglaum Co-op. She has a grocery store located at their house. She wants to borrow the amount of PHP 20,000 for additional capital to buy some stock of grocery items. She is a good and hard-working mother and always helps her husband in supporting the needs of the family.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of grocery items for her store

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
Name (Nome do Cliente): Alice T.
Internal Client ID (Numero do Expediente do Empréstimo18499
 Location (Localização / Sucursal): Namaacha
Primary Activity (Atividade Primaria): comercio 
 Loan Requested (Valor do Empréstimo em Meticais:10.000mt
Repayment Term (Numero de Prestações Mensais): 14
Loan Use (Uso do empréstimo, em 1 frase) compra e venda de produtos
Disbursement Hluvuku (Data de Desembolso do Empréstimo): 26/05/09
Dêscription (Historial


Alice nasceu em Goba - Namaacha, uma vila na Fronteira com a Swazilandia, tem 40 anos de idade e mãe de quatro filhos com idades compreendas entre os oito e 25 anos de idade, os três mais novos frenquentam a escola.

Alice apois concluir o ensino Primário é transferida para vila de Namaacha que dista 25 km da localidade de goba onde ela nasceu. Continua com os seus estudos e consegue fazer a 7ª classe, mas esta fica grávida e passa a viver com seu marido abandonando assim a escola, Este que era um grande comerciante. Anos depois o seu marido faleceu por motivo de doença e a vida fica difícil, então ela consegue arranjar um emprego na cidade capital (Maputo) como doméstica e trabalha durante dois anos onde recebia 2.300.00MT. Mas teve que abandonar, pois vivia longe dos seus filhos e regressa novamente a Namaacha onde inicia o seu próprio negócio de venda de pão e rebuçados no quintal da sua casa. Na tentativa de aumentar o volume do seu negócio aproxima se a Hluvuku solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00MT para. Tem como melhor produto pão de forma adquirido na vizinha Swazilândia. Para além dos seus filhos Alice não se responsabiliza por ninguém. Consegue, por mês, poupar algum valor. Diz que poderá pagar o empréstimo sem dificuldades e pedir outros para fazer crescer o negocio assim como satisfazer outros planos futuros.
texts.en:
Alice was born in Goba - Namaacha, a town on the on the border of Swaziland. She is 40 years old and the mother of 4 children with ages between 8 and 25 years old. The three youngest are in school. Alice, after completing elementary school, was transferred to the town of Namaacha, which is 25km from Goba where she was born. She continued with her schooling and made it through the 7th grade, but she became pregnant and went to live with her husband abandoning her education. Her husband was a great businessman. Years later her husband passed away from an illness, and her life became difficult. She was able to arrange a job in the capital (Maputo) as a housekeeper, and she worked for 2 years and earned 2,300MT. She had to quit since she lived far from her children so she returned again to Namaacha where she started her own business of selling bread and candies from her yard. In the attempt to grow the volume of her business she approached Hluvuku and solicited a loan in the amount of 10,000MT. Her best product is bread which she acquires in neighboring Swaziland. Besides her children Alice is not responsible for anyone. She is able to save a little each month. She says that she will be able to pay off this loan without difficulties, and she will request other loans to grow her business as well as realize her other future plans.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stocks in her business

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es: Rufino tiene 50 años, vive con su hijo de 25 años y también está al cuidado de su madre. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de animales menores (cuyes) en las principales ferias ganaderas de su localidad. Sus ventas las realiza todos los fines de semana y los demás días, con ayuda de su madre, se dedica al cuidado y alimentación de sus cuyes en la granja que ha implementado en su casa. Debido al buen cuidado que brinda a sus animales ha tenido buenas ventas porque sus cuyes tienen buen tamaño y peso. Para un futuro cercano, Rufino quiere ampliar su granja y mejorar la raza de sus animales para que siga adelante con sus ventas. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, su compromiso durante estos años (2) de trabajo en su banco comunal es reconocido por los demás integrantes y su deseo es seguir aportando lo mejor para el bienestar de su grupo. El dinero que está solicitando será destinado para la compra de gran cantidad de cuyes para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rufino is 50 years old. He lives with his 25 year old son, and is his mother's carer. For 4 years he has worked selling guinea pigs in the main markets in his neighbourhood. He makes his sales every weekend and on the other days, with the help of his mother, he cares for and feeds his guinea pigs in the farm he has built in his house. Owing to the good care that he offers his animals, he has had good sales, because his guinea pigs are of a good size and weight. In the near future, Rufino wants to expand his farm and improve the breed of his animals so he can move forward with his sales. This is the third time he has had a loan with MFP. His commitment during these 2 years of work in his communal bank is recognised by the other members and his desire is to continue to contribute the best for the wellbeing of his group. The money that he is seeking will be destined for the purchase of a large quantity of guinea pigs to increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of guinea pigs

loans.name: Deep

texts.en:
Deep is married with a family consisting of eight members, their ages varying from 20 to 4 years old. His business, which he established five years ago, is the only source of income for the family.

Deep sells electrical equipment and watches. He requested a 2,000 USD loan to expand his business. He appear in the photo at his business place.

loans.use: To purchase new goods for his shop

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 33-year-old hard working father. He is married to Norla of San Leonardo Aglipay Quirino. He is a “taho’” vendor in their village. According to him, he is proud being a vendor of taho because it is a nutritious kind of food, good for the children. Aside from that, through that “taho”, he is able to support the daily needs of his family. The product is made out of soya beans. According to him, he wants to improve their way of living by patiently maintaining his business and by asking for financial assistance from KIVA amounting to PHP5,000 as additional business capital.



Michael and his wife are blessed with three children, namely: Michael Jerome - 4 years old; Lassie - 3 years old; and the youngest, Michaelo Jersey - 2 years old. His children serve as the inspiration in life to work harder for a better future. He hopes that he will able to generate KIVA’s support so that someday, he will be able to improve their poor living situation in their simple place of San Leonardo.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Majit

texts.en:
L. Majit, age 47, supports his wife and child by selling cattle. As a rule, Majit purchases calves in the central market, raises them, and then sells them for higher prices in the local market. After having worked in this business for ten years, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them, and how to take care of them. He gets up early every morning in order to feed and look after the animals.

His knowledge and skills have allowed him to make his business successful and to generate a stable income for his large family. Majit plans to enlarge his stock and to purchase the cattle. With this purpose he requests 3,000 Somoni, which he will spend on the purchase of two young cattle.

You could become an important part of Majit's family's life. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only seven percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco Javier S. C. de 31 años de edad, proviene de la ciudad de Masaya, de la parte céntrica donde sobresale la artesanía, como lo son el trabajo en cuero, barro, camba entre otros.

Francisco es la cabeza de una familia joven formada por su hija de 6 años a quien le dedica su vida y trabajo y su esposa quien lo ha apoyado en sus proyectos y sueños. Él posee un taller artesanal, donde trabaja en la elaboración de calzado, como lo son Chinelas y zapato colegial. 

Aprendió el oficio, por que trabajó en un taller donde él era empleado o como ellos lo llaman “alistadores” (son quienes hacen toda la base del zapato, para luego entregársela a quien hace el acabado). Su tía distribuye calzado en diferentes zonas del país, entonces lo motivo a poner su propio taller, ofreciéndole ser ella quien le vendiera el zapato.

Francisco ha pasado situaciones muy difíciles, como lo fue cuando sufrió apendicitis y justo cuando se estaba recuperando su mamá falleció y ese golpe fue algo muy duro para su familia, pero sobre todo para él. A pesar de todo, con la ayuda de su esposa, el ánimo y el amor de su hija, decidió esforzarse mucho más y con los créditos han logrado poner una mini-pulpería.

Su crédito actual pretende invertirlo en acrecentar la mini-pulpería y en materia prima para su taller.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier S. C. is 31 years old, and comes from the central part of the City of Masaya. This area specializes in the production of handicrafts, such as leather work, pottery, plastic, and others. Francisco is the head of a young family which includes his daughter of 6 years, to whom he dedicates his life and work, and his wife, who has supported him in all of his projects and dreams. He owns a handicraft workshop, where he works making footwear, such as slippers and shoes for schoolchildren. He learned the trade because he worked as an employee in a workshop in the occupation that they call "alistadores" (this term refers to those who make the sole of the shoe, and later give it to those who finish it.) His aunt distributes shoes in different areas of the country; this motivated him to have his own workshop, since she offered to sell the shoes that he would produce. Francisco has passed through some difficult situations, as when he suffered appendicitis, and was just recovering when his mother died. This loss was very hard for his family, but most of all for him. In spite of this, with the help of his wife and the encouragement and love of his daughter, he decided to exert himself much more and, with the loans that he secured, establish a mini grocery store. The current loan will be invested in the growth of the mini grocery and in raw materials for his workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: products for the store and materials for the workshop

loans.name: Felicidad Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado  FELICIDAD, está conformado por 16 señoras que en su mayoría radican en la Zona San Jose de La Paz; la característica principal de sus domicilios en su mayoría son de un piso  son  construido de ladrillo, con techos de calamina. La directiva está conformada por la Sra.Feliza, Nilda y Exalta, las socias que conforman el  grupo tienen diferentes negocios como: venta de carne de cerdo, venta de comida, venta de material escolar, venta de frutas, venta de abarrotes y otros. Sus negocios están situados en dos lugares estratégicos de venta y de bastante afluencia de compradores. Ellas necesitan el crédito para incrementar su capital de trabajo; ellas están muy animadas para trabajar con Agrocapital. Este grupo está emprendiendo su primer ciclo, la mayoría de ellas  se conocen por la zona que habitan. Además la mayoría de las socias trabajan juntas en otras financieras y se conocen como grupo mancomunado.

loans.use: INCREMENTO DE CAPITAL

loans.name: Barikisu

texts.en:
Barikisu is forty-three years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She works to help her husband financially to provide for the family. She is a petty trader.

Barikisu sells all kinds of cereals such as maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. She procures the goods from nearby communities and sells at the local market to food vendors and retailers. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith lives in Edo State, Nigeria. She sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers to earn a living. She is a hard working woman and she is determined to lift her business with this Kiva loan. She is 42 years old and married with four children. Her husband is an engineer and he also supports the home. She hopes for a loan of N60,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Agustin

texts.en: Agustin C. is 55 years old and lives in the town of Encarnacion, where he has been a vendor for his whole life. He runs his small business from a stall in town, where he sells a range of items to a large and busy customer base. He earns enough money to pay for a home and meet his other expenses. He is applying for a loan for 1,500,000 PYGs to buy more merchandise for his stall. Sales are always higher at the end of the year during the holidays, and Agustin hopes to take advantage of this demand to increase his income and profits.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Las Muñequitas Dos Group

texts.es: Una D. las características más importantes del Grupo “Las Muñequitas Dos” es que su presidenta la señora Carmen que al igual que el resto D. las socias es madre D. familias que buscan el sustento y el bien estar D. sus familias. Entre las actividades que realizan son las socias esta la venta D. comida, venta D. pan, venta D. ropa y al servicio en moto Taxis. La competencia respeto a sus negocios es fuerte ya que las señoras tienen que competir con otros negocios similares ya bien establecidos en áreas comerciales como ser restaurantes y panaderías pero ese las motiva a trabajar mas para poder llegar a ser personas D. éxito. El crédito será utilizaran para mejorar mas sus negocios y poder dar una mejor atención a su clientela con los arreglos y ampliaciones y con la adquisición D. nueva mercadería D. mejor calidad.  Tiene experiencia ya que la gran mayoría D. las socias trabajaron en Instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital y conocen la forma D. trabajo.
texts.en:
One of the most important characteristics of the "Las Muñequitas Dos" group is that their president, Carmen, just like the rest of the members, is a mother who is seeking sustenance and well being for her family. Among the activities that the members carry out are selling food, selling bread, selling clothes, and motorbike taxi service. The competition for these businesses is strong because the women have to compete with other similar businesses that are already well established in commercial sectors such as restaurants and bakeries, this motivates them to work harder in order to become successful. The loan will be used to further improve their businesses and to give better attention to their customers in the form of repairs and upgrades and to buy new merchandise of better quality. The great majority of the members worked in similar institutions at the Fundación Agrocapital and understand this type of work.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Rafail

texts.en: Rafail was born in 1959. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli region. He is now settled in the Finnish houses in the Fuzuli region. Rafail has a sheep-breeding business and he has five years of experience in this business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy six sheep to improve his sheep-breeding business.

loans.use: To buy six sheep

loans.name: Khoshimkul

texts.ru: Урозов Хошимкул проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 47 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Урозов Хошимкул имеет среднее образование. Работает более чем 7 лет в области животноводства. Урозов Хошимкул откармливает и продает скот. Берет кредит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Khoshimkul U. lives in the Khuroson region. He is 47 years old. Married with 3 children. Khoshimkul has a high-school level education. He has been working for over 7 years in livestock breeding. Khoshimkul fattens up and sells cattle. He is requesting the loan to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Jokudu

texts.en:
Jokudu M. is currently in the business of selling sodas and ice cream and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of sodas and beer to sell. Jokudu is 40 years old and is widowed. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of sodas and beer to sell

loans.name: Manis Kasih Cooperative (Group B)

texts.en: Manis Kasih Women’s Cooperative (Sweet Love) is a village banking organization located in Manistutu village near the town of Melaya in northwest Bali. Manis Kasih was originally formed out of the initiative of mothers who, at the time, found it very difficult to obtain loans to develop their businesses. Local banks had numerous requirements that were quite burdensome to the women and thus made it difficult to secure loans. This group was formed to make loans more accessible to the women in the region and, with its continued growth, became a legal entity in Bali in 2007. At this time, Manis Kasih Women’s Cooperative has 126 members, all of whom are mothers of children of various ages. The group is located in a rural region of Bali, thus the majority of the women utilizing these loans work in agriculture as farmers, breeders or traders. Other women own small shops that sell daily goods such as rice, soap, etc. In this group there are also a few tailors and chocolate traders who will receive loans. To meet the needs of its members and allow them to expand their businesses, Manis Kasih Women’s Cooperative is working with Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) and Kiva to receive a loan fund that will be managed by the group leadership in accordance with the rules the members have established. The leadership team pictured here will receive this loan and will distribute it to a group of approximately forty women who are all members of Manis Kasih. The loan money will allow the women to expand their respective businesses by buying new livestock, food or supplies for their animals, or by buying items to sell in their stores. This subset of the Manis Kasih is headed by Ni Putu B. and they have requested a loan in the amount of 25,000,000 IDR. Ni Putu B. is a chocolate merchant. As the wife of a farmer, she chooses to not stay at home quietly, simply relying on her husband’s income. Instead, she searches for additional family income by riding on her motorcycle around the village each day to buy local crops such as coconuts, bananas and chocolate that she can sell in markets in neighboring regions. With her profits from this venture she supplements her husband’s income primarily to pay the school fees of her two young children. Note to Kiva Lenders: This group uses a community lending model (commonly referred to as Village Banking) that is very common throughout Asia. In this model, a select number of group representatives will take out a large loan on behalf of their entire group (often an entire village). They will then distribute and manage the loan and collect repayments for the lender. This is a common and efficient practice in the region, but it makes reporting on Kiva somewhat unusual. Unlike most other loans, Kiva’s partner, MUK, will be in contact primarily with the group leadership team who in turn will be overseeing the end borrowers. As such, journal updates likely will reflect the performance of the lending group rather than the individual end borrowers. To learn more about Village Banking on Wikipedia, please click here.

loans.use: To buy more local crops such as coconuts, bananas and chocolate

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en:
Phanice A. is a 43-year-old single mother of three (3) children and a businesswoman in Nambale. She has been in business since 2007. She started with raising poultry and later ventured into clothes selling which acts as an income-generator and is less time-consuming.

Phanice buys her stock in Busia on a monthly basis and has a plan to expand her business. After learning about how to improve one's business from KMET and about loans, she was interested and saw that this might be her opportunity to meet her goal. She would like a loan for Ksh.10,000 as a way of starting somewhere on her road to success.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es el ensamblaje de computadoras, reparación de las mismas, instalacion de software y otras que tengan relación con  computadoras.

El crédito que solicita será utilizado para la compra de un par de computadoras, que le servirán para realizar su trabajo con mayor facilidad y mejor calidad de servicios.

Es cliente de impro desde el año 2007 y paga muy bien, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Juan lives in his parent's home in the Sopocachi neighborhood in the city La Paz. He assembles and repairs computers, installs software, and does anything related to computers for a living. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a couple of computers that he will use to carry out his business with greater ease and better quality of service. He has been a client of Impro since 2007 and pays on time so he can access new loans.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two computers for his business of fixing computer systems, software, etc.

loans.name: Valens

texts.en:
Valens is 29 years old and is single. He is a self-employed businessman selling a variety of goods in his shop. Those goods include electronic and electrical items as the photo indicate. Included are power bars, simple radio receivers, etc. Valens has been in this business for about seven years and his is usually open from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day.

Valens needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Compny in order to expand his store by adding more hardware iterms to his shop. With these additional goods, he hopes that he will attract more customers and his sales will increase as well as his profits.

With the extra profits, Valens will keep reinvesting in his business for the purpose of being financially stable and he will also start saving for his future.

loans.use: To purchase more electronic and electrical items

loans.name: Karina Margot

texts.es:
Karina tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos que son menores de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Chepén, perteneciente a la provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de dos años a la venta ambulante de pan, ella ofrece su producto en una plaza bastante frecuentada de la ciudad de Chepén y ofrece su mercadería a los transeúntes que circulan por la zona, ella ofrece sus productos todos los dias muy temprano en la mañana y también por la tarde. Este negocio constituye una fuente importante de ayuda para la economía de su familia, por lo que ella trata de mantener su actividad con mucho esfuerzo.

El puesto de venta goza de buena acogida y Karina desea ampliarlo con la compra de mas productos para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 400 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de embutidos, mantequillas y otros productos que acompañan el desayuno y el lonche (comida ligera tomada entre el almuerzo y la cena, suele consumirse entre las cinco y las siete de la noche).

Karina es una mujer emprendedora y que siempre vela por el bienestar de su familia, su mayor anhelo es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y hombres de bien, ella es muy querida y estimada por sus vecinos y conocidos, ellos la consideran una mujer de confianza y responsable.
texts.en:
Karina is 34 years old, married, and has two young children. She lives with her family in the District of Chepén, which is part of the province of the same name. This community is located in the region of La Libertad, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Karina has been selling bread as a street vendor for more than two years. She offers her products in a busy plaza in the city of Chepén to passersby who come through the area. Karina sells her products every day early in the morning and also in the afternoon. This business is an important source of income to her family, so she tries to maintain it with great effort.

Her vending post receives many customers, which is why she wants to expand her business by purchasing more products so that she can offer more variety. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 400 PEN. She wants to buy sausages, butter, and other products that are served for breakfast and snacks (most people take a light meal between lunch and dinner, usually eaten between 5-7pm).

Karina is an enterprising woman who always looks after the welfare of her family. Her greatest wish is to see her children become professionals and develop into good people. She is well-liked and respected by her neighbors and acquaintances, who consider her to be a trustworthy and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase butter, sausages, and other products to sell in addition to bread

loans.name: Magaly Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María José pertenece a la parroquia Picoaza en la capital manabita, es un sitio muy comercial donde sus habitantes viven en comercio informal, es aquí donde cada año realizan la feria del juguete y además de tener los precios mas bajos en todas sus mercadería, aquí en este sitio hay cantidad de negocios, como la venta de ropa, accesorios para el hogar, accesorios para los celulares y mas productos desde ahí llevan a vender a otras partes de la provincia.

Al visitar este banco comunal pudimos conocer de una de las comerciantes de la parroquia, la señora Magaly, esta casada a sus 39 años tiene dos hijos y se dedica al comercio de compra y venta de hamacas (camas colgantes), en estas hamacas se utiliza el material de hilo traídas directamente de una parte de la sierra en la provincia de Imbabura extramente en Otavalo hasta ese lugar se traslada la socia a comprar a los mayoristas, pero en los últimos tiempos ya son los distribuidores que le visitan a su domicilio para entregarle los pedidos que realiza por mes.

De las ventas esta encargado el esposo es quien entrega los pedidos, ellos entregan a comerciantes que recorren el país, los precios de las hamacas están estimados entre 13, 8  y 4 dólares al por mayor, dependiendo como este la demanda hacen los pedios pero es cada 15 días lo mas habitual, ya son cliente fijos que van directamente a la casa a comprar, con el nuevo crédito que va a recibir la señora Magaly invertirá en unas 300 hamacas que tiene por entregar durante el mes. Con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir en más hamacas.
Nos contó que cuando inició el negocio aun manteníamos la moneda del sucre,  hace 20 años que tiene las ventas de las hamacas y esta muy conforme con su trabaja, a pesar que se desempeña como profesora en una escuela desde hace 7 años, no ha descuidado su negocio.
texts.en:
The María José Communal Bank is located in Picoaza parish in the capital Manabita. It is a very commercial location where the inhabitants carry out informal commerce. Here each year they have a toy fair with the lowest prices on all their merchandise. In this site are a quantity of business, selling clothing, accessories for the home, accessories for cellular phones, and many other products are shipped to other parts of the province to sell. Upon visiting the communal bank we would learn that one of the parish merchants, Mrs. Magaly, is married, 39 years old and has 2 children, and buys and sells hammocks (hanging beds). These hammocks are made with thread brought directly from the mountainous part of the province of Imbabura, near Otavalo. Magaly used to go there herself to buy wholesale, but in the last few seasons, it is the distributors who visit her house to fill her monthly orders. Her husband is in charge of delivering the orders received from merchants who cover the country. The hammocks sell for 4, 8, or 13 dollars wholesale, depending on demand. Normally, every 15 days orders are taken from fixed clients who go directly to her home. With the new loan Magaly will invest in some 300 hammocks that are to be delivered during the month. Magaly tells us that when she began her business Ecuador still used the sucre as curency. She has been selling hammocks for 20 years and enjoys her work. Despite also serving as a school teacher for the last 7 years, she has not abandoned her business.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING HAMMOCKS TO SELL

loans.name: Denis Leonel

texts.es: Denis Leonel G. C. de 26 años de edad, reside en el pueblito de Panchimalco ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa la cual le ayuda con el negocio y así mismo se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, así mismo vive junto a sus 3 hijos de 12, 8 años de edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar, y la menor la cual es una bebé de 8 meses de edad. Denis posee un puesto ubicado en el mercado municipal de Santa Tecla, en donde comercializan frutas, sobretodo melones, los cuales se venden bastante. Denis trabaja junto a su esposa con el deseo de poder brindarles a sus hijos una vida mejor como la que ellos tuvieron, en la cual cuenten con todo lo básico y necesario para una vida digna. Es por esta razón que el solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda comprar manzanas por mayor, ya que es esta la mayor temporada de estas en este país, y a las cuales se les puede obtener un poco más de ganancias. Denis desea con todo su corazón el poder aumentar sus ventas y de esta forma mejorar su vida familiar económicamente hablando.
texts.en:
Denis Leonel G. C. is 26 years old and resides in the tiny village of Panchimalco, which is located in the Department of San Salvador. He lives with his wife who helps with his business and is also in charge of the household chores. They have three children. The two older children, ages 12 and 8, attend school while the youngest child is only eight months old.

Denis manages a vending post at the municipal market in Santa Tecla where he sells fruits, especially melons, which are in great demand. He and his wife work together because they want to provide their children with a better life than they had. They hope to give them all the basic necessities so that they can have a decent life. For this reason, Denis is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can buy apples in bulk since this is the best time of the year to buy them in El Salvador. This will allow him to generate a little more income. He hopes with all of his heart to increase his sales and improve his family’s financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase apples in bulk

loans.name: Tsanjidmaa

texts.en:
Tsanjidmaa B. is 51 years old and lives with her family in Zavhan province in western Mongolia. Her family enjoys a comfortable lifestyle and they all are in good health. Her husband and oldest son both work as drivers and her youngest son is an electrician for a construction company.

Tsanjidmaa operates a wood and timber trading business in her area. Since starting in 2006 she has made much progress with her business and has used her business to improve her family's life. She is optimistic about the future and hopes to work with her husband to expand his transportation business to an adjoining province.

Tsanjidmaa is a modest woman and always remains optimistic about achieving her goals. She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase timber for her business and petrol (gasoline) for her transport truck.

loans.use: To purchase more timber to sell and gasoline for her truck

loans.name: Rosario Lucy

texts.es:
La Señora Rosario Lucy A. F.  está casada por más de 20 años con el Señor Juan Fanor Medrano Villegas,  tienen 1 hija las cuales acuden a la escuela de la zona todas las mañanas y por las tardes ayuda a su mama con el cuidado de las vacas. 

La Señora Rosario vive en la Zona conocida como Maica Norte en Cochabamba, donde tiene vacas, cuya leche vende a una empresa que se encarga de elaborar diferentes productos lácteos, por más de 10 años que vende toda su producción de leche cruda a esta empresa.

La Señora Rosario ya obtuvo 2 créditos anteriores con nuestra institución y demostró ser una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, además desde el primer crédito hasta la fecha duplico su producción de leche y la cantidad  de vacas que tiene. Nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es ver a su hija ser buena profesional y que tenga una vida mejor que la que tuvo ella y si Dios quiere vivir lo suficiente para poder ver a su hija casada y con muchos hijos.
texts.en:
Rosario Lucy A. F. has been maried to Jan Fanor Medrano Villegas for over 20 years. They have one daughter. She goes to the local school every morning, and in the afternoon she helps her mother take care of the cows. Rosario lives in the area known as Maica Norte in Cochabamba. She has cows there, and she sells their milk to a company that makes different dairy products. She has been selling all of her raw milk production to this company for over ten years. Rosario has had two previous loans with our institution. She has demonstrated herself to be a very hard-working and responsible person. Also, from the time of her first loan up until now she doubled her milk production and the number of cows that she has. She tells us that her biggest dream is to see her daughter become a professional and have a better life than Rosario had. Also, God willing, she wants to live long enough to be able to see her daughter married with lots of children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D. est une femme de 30 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KABENDOU depuis le 22 janvier 2007 et a reçu 07 fois de suite de crédit et remboursement toujours régulièrement. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de pâte d'arachide. Elle achète des arachides à l'état brute, c'est-à-dire en gousse, elle les décortique, les grille avant de les transformer en pâte et vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans et en a acquière une bonne expérience. Avec son prêt elle va acheter de l'arachide afin de poursuivre son activité. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Mariama D. is a 30-year old woman, married and the mother of two children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Kabendou since January 22, 2007 and obtained loans seven times in the past, always repaying them on schedule. She prepares and sells peanut paste. She purchases peanuts raw, that is to say in their shells; she shells and grills the peanut in order to prepare peanut paste to be sold at the weekly market. She has been in this line of business for over five years and has accumulated a lot of experience. With this loan she would like to purchase a supply of peanuts in order to continue with this business. She contributes to improving the life conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her business capital

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.en:
Dionicio C. is from the village of Cabisera 5, Ilagan, Isabela. He is 44 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Dionicio owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Dionicio has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 22,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2010, Dionicio joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be his first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Buntuuse Farmers Assocation, Lugazi Group

texts.en:
Success in any business is not necessarily measured by what an individual has achieved but by the obstacles that the individual has overcome along the way as he or she transacts. 27-year-old K. John has had a checkered track record that he says makes him carry conviction that the above is true.

In the four years John has been plying his retail shop business, he has come to terms with the fact that when one experiences firsthand the hardships associated with running a business, it becomes a defining moment in the success or failure of that venture.

The married father of one has brought personal values to his business with determination and perseverance. Weekly, his business generates him 40,000 shillings and, because the cost of living in Busaale, Lugazi, is not that high, John can successfully make ends meet.

With the auspices of this loan, John wants to buy more bags of sugar, bags of rice, and bars of soap for his retail shop. He is planning on selling them to earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase of more bags of sugar, bags of rice, and bars of soap to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes to resell

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es: Rufino, de 40 años, está casado y tiene cuatro hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tiene su propio techo a base de madera. A pesar de que tuvo primaria incompleta, Rufino asegura que  “la agricultura fue su escuela”; ya que con ello aprendió el negocio agrícola, específicamente al cultivo y comercialización de café en donde sus compradores asiduos están satisfechos por la calidad de sus productos. Usualmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda e su familia, pero en tiempo de cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones, con la necesidad de que extraigan su producto en menor tiempo, siendo éstos vendidos en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su producción en otras zonas estratégicas con el propósito de minimizar costo y tiempo, de esa manera pueda tener un posicionamiento fuerte en su valle. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además esta fortalecido y entusiasmado con su banco comunal, ya que la trae muchas ventajas positivas. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abonos con la necesidad de que lo pueda dar un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
40-year old Rufino is married and has four school-aged children. They live in the neighbourhood of Quimbiri on the edge of the Peruvian rainforest. He owns a house made of wood. Although he did not complete his primary education, Rufino explains that ‘the farm was his school’. This is where he learnt how to farm, specifically how to grow and sell coffee. His regular customers are pleased with the quality of his products. Rufino usually works by himself and on occasion he gets help from family members. At harvest time he takes on extra laborers so that the harvest can be completed quickly and he can sell the coffee in the warehouses near where he lives. In the future he wants to expand into different areas in order to minimize costs and time, giving him a strong presence in the valley. This is Rufino’s sixth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he promises to pay back the money according to the schedule. He is happy with the support and enthusiasm of his community bank which has provided him with many advantages. With the loan he plans to buy supplies and fertilizer so he can give his coffee fields appropriate care.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee fields

loans.name: Perla Marisol

texts.es: La señora Perla Marisol es madre de 2 niños adolescentes, y es muy trabajadora, ella trabaja en una casa de empeño de la localidad, su esposo el Señor Juan Antonio, le ayuda en el hogar, ya que hace poco se quedo sin trabajo, aunque en unos días empieza en un nuevo trabajo. Ellos necesitan de este préstamo para impermeabilizar su vivienda, ya que con las lluvias se trasmite la humedad y daña las paredes de su casa.
texts.en:
Perla Marisol is a hardworking mother of 2 adolescent children. She works in a pawn shop in her area. Her husband, Juan Antonio, helps her with the house, since he recently lost his job, although in a few days he will start a new job. They need this loan to weatherproof their home, since when it rains moisture seeps into the house and damages the walls of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to weatherproof their home

loans.name: Juliana Mutindi

texts.en:
Juliana is married and they have one child whom she supports. She was introduced to KADET LTD by existing clients of KADET. Juliana is servicing a third loan from KADET after repaying her previous loans well and on time.  Juliana has been in the boutique business for three years. With the loan, Juliana will purchase clothes to sale in her boutique.The business is located in Kayole, a very busy place and most of her customers are the area's residents.

With the profits, Juliana will build some rental houses on her piece of land. She hopes to build rental rooms and maximize her income.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell in her boutique.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita C. is from the village of Montol, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children.

Elenita owns and operates a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for 13 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In April 2010, Elenita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

Elenita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP that will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and for motorcycle maintenance. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Jose Silvestre

texts.en:
Jose lives in the Anexo de Tinajones near the village of Huaca de Barro, which is located in the district of Mochumi in the region of Lambayeque. He is marred and has four children. The community is quite small and the entire population is involved in agriculture.

For the past fifteen years, Jose has worked in the agricultural industry in his community. He owns a hectare of land on which he usually plants cotton, corn and rice. He is well known and respected in the area for his hard work and knowledge of crop management.

In this season, Jose plans to plant a crop of cotton and has, therefore, requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa. He plans to invest the funds in seed, fertilizer, pesticides and other inputs. He hopes the investment will allow him to maximize his production and crop yield. This will be Jose’s first loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase cotton seed, fertilizer, pesticides and other inputs

loans.name: Nancy Delia

texts.es:
Nancy de 25 años, tiene una pequeña tienda y es madre soltera con dos niños de 5 y 2 años. Viven con sus hijos en una zona periurbana ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Hace 5 años atrás ella inicio con su tienda con pocos víveres para poderle dar una mejor vida a sus hijos. Por esa buena decisión ahora trabaja en su tienda desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm vendiendo enlatados como atunes a $ 1.15, arroz por libra a $ 0.28, azúcar por libra a $ 0.50. Para seguir con su negocio y que le genere más ingresos ella quiere surtir mas la tienda comprando con el préstamo arroz azúcar, bebidas. 

En el futuro quiere tener un local mas surtido y comprar un carro para lleva la mercadería más pesada.
texts.en:
Nancy, 25, is the single mother of two children ages 5 and 2. She lives with her children near the Guayaquil Perimetral road, in an area surrounded by an estuary.

Five years ago, with the goal of giving her children a better life, she started a business of selling a few staples from home. That turned out to be a good decision, as she now works from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm and sells many more things, such as canned tuna (which she sells for $1.15) rice ($0.28/kilo), sugar ($0.50/kilo), etc. In order to grow her business and increase her profits she would like to buy a bigger number and variety of products to sell, including rice, sugar and beverages. In the future, she hopes to be able to buy a car to help with the transport of heavy merchandise.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, beverages, etc

loans.name: Oswaldo Agustin

texts.es:
Oswaldo Agustin V. B. tiene 29 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y con el hijo,  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1  hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. YAGUI GRANDE se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y papas, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Oswaldo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato y San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y papas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es arreglar la casa.

Le gusta hacer deporte y festejar las fiestas del carnaval como es costumbre.
texts.en:
Oswaldo Agustin V. B. is 29 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and their son in San Miguel Canton, Bolívar Province.

He is a member of Yagui Grande communal bank, which is located 30 minutes from the San Miguel office in San Miguel Canton.  This bank's members are farmers who grow short season corn and potatoes.  The work takes a lot of time.

Oswaldo also grows corns and potatoes.  He buys his products in Ambato and San Miguel, and he sells them at the market in San Miguel on Thursdays.

He is asking for the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers for growing corn and potatoes.  The loan will help him meet his financial needs.  He faces challenges like pests, crop diseases and weather changes.  His dream is to fix up his house.

He likes to play sports and celebrate carnival, which is a tradition here.

loans.use: Supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.ru:
Gulnar S. 36 let . Ona ne zamujem. Gulnar yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Kalbadjar , seychas projivayet v Asbheron regioen vmeste so svoyey semyoy.

Ona uje 10 let kak rabotayet uchitelniccey , etoy rabote ona nauchilas u svoyey mami tak kak i ona bila uchitelniccey a tak je ona okonchila specialnoye uchilishe.  Gulmaya seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit testi i knigi dlya detey u kotorix net vozmojnosti samim pokupat. Gulmaya gotovit detey dlya postupleniya v universiteti , kajdiy qod vixodyat noviye kniqi i testi dlya podqotovki v universitet i oni stoyat ochen doroqo ne kajdiy mojet pokupat eti knigi i gotovitsya i poeotomu Gulmaya pokupayet eti knigi i dayet im uchitsya po etim knigam posle cheqo oni vozvrashayut yey eti knigi.
texts.en: Gulnar S., 26, is an internally displaced person who had to resettle from Absheron to Kalbadjar with her family. Gulnar is single. A daugther of a teacher and a graduate of a teachers' college, Gulnar spent the last ten years teaching. She prepares school children for university entrance exams, and every year she needs to purchase new preparation materials for her students. She is applying for a loan of 2000 AZN that would allow her to buy tests and books for those school children who can't afford it.

loans.use: to buy tests and books

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen A. O. is 28 years old, single and has a three-year-old child to whom she hopes to provide a quality education to university level. Hellen's business is located at Nyalenda in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region in Kenya known for fish production from Lake Victoria and is well known as the lake basin. 
Hellen owns a grocery store in which she sells eggs, tomatoes, onions, kale and green vegetables. She has been in this business for four years now. She says that her business is profitable and the only major challenge she faces is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy more vegetables to meet customer demand. She hopes to expand her business, get married and start a beautiful family. She describes herself as an honest and humble lady.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SUMAC SONCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gloria; ella tiene 57 años D. edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la venta D. ropa ella viaja hasta la ciudad D. Lima para luego distribuirlo a sus amistades y familiares también trae D. allá artefactos como licuadoras, cámaras fotograficas, planchas entre otros más, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio y D. esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  más mercadería para su negocio y para pagar sus pasajes hasta la ciudad D. Lima.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the SUMAC SONCCO Communal Bank, located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

She is Mrs. Gloria. She is 57, married, and has 2 children. She sells clothing and travels to the city of Lima in order to later distribute the clothing to her friends and family. She also brings back articles such as blenders, cameras, and irons, among other items. She has had this business for a long time and this is how she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting this loan to purchase more merchandise for her business and to pay the fares for her trips to Lima.

She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her business and to pay the fare for her trips to Lima.

loans.name: Hau

texts.en:
Hau T. T. is a 53 year old woman, who lives in Tuan le village. Since receiving her first loan in 2004, she not only invested in doing farming, but also running a small shop that sells ready cooked food in the local market. Her extra job became the main source of her daily income. 

Participating for 7 years in SEDA, she has always been a good repayer. To develop her business more, she wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 VND  to buy a glass table to put food inside to ensure the food safety requirement is met.

loans.use: To buy a glass table to put food inside to ensure the food safety requirement is met.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem S., 60, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia – an area known for palm products. S. is a traditional doctor, earning $3 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $50 US on food and $10 US on other expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $1000 US to purchase a new motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
The woman shown in the picture is Orn R., age 34, a married woman who currently lives in Kompong Tom province. She earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she also cultivates a rice crop, while her husband earns as a firewood seller. They have four children, three of whom are single and the other one is married. 

Orn R. is seeking a loan to buy two buffalo to be used by her husband to transport firewood to sell in the local market. The buffalo can also be used for breeding purposes, so they can also raise the offspring.

loans.use: To buy two buffalo to be used by her husband to transport firewood to sell

loans.name: Carlos José

texts.es: En la ciudad de Managua, El   Sr. Carlos José J. Reyes, se dedica  arduamente a laborar como agente de seguridad  dedicándose a esta labor desde hace cinco  años, es casado y con un hijo al que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrolle. Una de las necesidades que el  Sr. Carlos  atraviesa hoy en día es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones por lo que a tomado la sabia decisión de iniciar la obra de mejora. Es por ese motivo que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines y pintura, Para realizar la mejora de  la vivienda realizando  el cambio de techo  en su casa de habitación y pintarla. Por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones de vida a su hijo. Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra, le proporcionara a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias para el desarrollo de sus hijos.
texts.en: In the city of Managua, Carlos José J. R.works hard as a security guard; he has been in this line of work for five years. He is married and has a son whom he has to provide for so that he will grow up well. One of the things Carlos needs right now is to improve living conditions and his home because it has been in bad shape, so he decided to start working to improve it. It is for this reason that he has approached Kiva partner Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase construction materials such as zinc, beams, and paint. To make improvements to his home, he will rebuild the roof and paint the house. This will allow him to improve his son's quality of life. It is important to point out that by doing this work, he will give his family a dignified place to live that will satisfy his children's needs as they grow up.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as zinc, beams, and paint

loans.name: Adalberto Aquiles

texts.es:
Don Adalberto, reside en Osicala departamento de Morazán, tiene 44 años de edad, se dedica a la siembra y producción de maíz, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 22 y 18 años de edad, él aprendió el oficio por sus padres y hoy día este es el que provee los ingresos para sus hijos. 
Actualmente solicita préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y semilla mejorada de maíz, esta inversión le ayudara a realizar el cultivo de la mejor manera, con los cuidados necesarios para que produzca abundantemente.
Para don Adalberto, apoyar a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante es el objetivo primordial, además de trabajar porque algún día tengan casa propia.
texts.en: Mr. Adalberto lives in Osicala, a region of Morazán.  He is 44 years old and works farming corn.  He lives with his wife and their two children who are 22 and 18.  He learned this trade from his parents and currently is the one who provides for his children.  He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and improved seed corn.  This investment will help him improve his crop, and with care, will help it produce abundantly.  For Mr. Adalberto, supporting his children and helping them get ahead is his most important objective.  He also is working to someday have their own home.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and improved seed corn

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: Lucila works hard to support two children. She is a widow and has a general-store business in the Philippines. Lucila requested an 1,800 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the cookstove because she wants to save money by using the dried wood she can pick from her surroundings. Lucila is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cleaner, more efficient cookstove

loans.name: Shama's Group

texts.en:
Shama is 28 years old and married with two children. Both of them are very young and not of school going age yet. Shama is involved in a veterinary medicine business. Her clientele is her community because most people are involved in the livestock business. To keep their cattle healthy, they come to her to buy medicines. She is also a very good housewife and manages her household responsibilities very well. Her husband works in a factory for a low income.  Shama’s father and brother also live with her. Both of them also work and contribute to the family financially, which helps Shama and her husband with the household expenses. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her own business. With the loan, she will buy veterinary medicines for the further improvement of her business. She has been operating this business for the past nine years. She is hopeful that a loan will be productive for her.

loans.use: To buy veterinary medicines to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 20 years old and lives in Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Judith has a business selling coffee, which she has run for two years. She also has a second business selling bread.
To help expand her business, Judith has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more coffee for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Judith hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.
Judith is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her more job skills such as agriculture and tailoring.

loans.use: to purchase more coffee for resale.

loans.name: Amor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Amor lo conforman la señora Dominga, Guadalupe, Maximo y wilber cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Nindiri, Masaya. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Dominga quien se dedica al comercio de perecederos en el mercado Oriental, el más grande de Nicaragua.

Ella con el crédito comprara cosechas de frutas y verduras de temporada ya que esto le sale más barato.

 La señora Guadalupe desde hace cuatro años se dedica al comercio de ropa negocio que tiene el mercado Oriental, Máximo vende ropa en el mercado de Masaya y Wilber comercializa ropa de manera ambulante desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en:
The Amor (Love) group is comprised of Dominga, Guadalupe, Maximo, and Wilber, four hardworking and entrepreneurial people originally from Nindiri, Masaya.The group's coordinator is Dominga, who sells perishables in the Oriental market, the biggest one in Nicaragua.

She will use this loan to purchase fruits and vegetables harvested in season, because they are least expensive.

Guadalupe has had a business selling clothes at the Oriental market for four years. Maximo sells clothes in the Masaya market, and Wilber has been a traveling clothes salesman for four years.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables harvested in season

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es:
Sonia, trabaja en la instalación de teléfonos y venta de hamacas, tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposo y no tiene hijos, ella trabaja desde hace 8 años en la instalación de teléfonos, tiene dos empleados que le ayudan a realizar el trabajo.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la reparación del vehículo de trabajo,  ya que tiene desperfectos mecánicos y necesita repararle la corona y comprar el juego de llantas.
Con este préstamo tendrá la oportunidad de realizar el trabajo de manera eficiente con su vehículo en buenas condiciones, dándole mayor seguridad para ejecutar el trabajo, su aspiración es que este negocio crezca y genere mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Sonia works in telephone installations and selling hammocks.  She is 35 years old, lives with her husband, and has no children.  She has been in telephone installations for 8 years, and has two employees that help her with her work. 

Currently, she requests a loan to make repairs to her work vehicle, as it has mechanical problems and she needs to repair its crown and buy a new set of tires.

With this loan, she’ll have the opportunity to carry out her work in an efficient manner with a vehicle that is in good condition.  This will give her greater security to execute her work.  Her aspiration is for this business to grow and generate more income.

loans.use: repair the crown of her work vehicle and buy a new set of tires for it.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi est mariée à une tresseuse et est père de quatre(04)  enfants. Lui même est âgé de  37 ans et est revendeur de chaussures à Adidogomé. Komi à commencé son activité depuis 1986  et s’approvisionne à Lomé sur marché de chaussures  de la place(Hédzranawoé).Komi est à son quatrième cycle de crédit  et est de bonne moralité. Afin d’assurer son rôle de chef de famille  Komi se bat  au quotidien pour apporter  l’assurance financière aux siens.
texts.en:
Komi is married to a hair braider and is a father of four. He himself is 37 years old and retails shoes in Adidogomé. Komi launched his business in 1986 and gets his supplies from Lomé, at the public shoe market of Hédzranawoé.
Komi is on his fourth loan cycle and is of good character. In order to perform his role as the head of the household, Komi strives daily to bring financial safety to his family.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: Maria De La Concepción de 49 años, tiene 4 hijos y solamente 2 están bajo su cargo. Ella se dedica la venta de cosméticos. Empezó hace 3 años porque le gusta el comercio antes no tenía trabajo estable que decidió vende estos productos por su sector y a la vez de manera ambulante es así que ella ha tenido una gran variedad de clientes. Labora diariamente en las mañana y en las tarde es así que se dedica a promocionar sus productos. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar materiales como lápiz labial, pintura de uñas, cremas, tratamientos, polvos, perfumes entre otros. En un futuro quiere seguir aumentando su inventario.
texts.en: Maria De La Concepción is 49 years old.  She has four children, however, only two are under her care.   She makes her living selling cosmetics.  She started three ago because she liked the business.  Previously she didn’t have a steady job, so she decided to sell these products in her area.  At the time, she sold her products on foot and this is how she gained a wide variety of customers.  She works everyday, mornings and evenings, to promote her products.  With the help of this loan, she wants to buy lipstick, nail polish, cream, beauty treatments, powders, perfume, and other items.  In the future, she wishes to continue increasing her inventory.

loans.use: to purchase lipstick, nail polish, cream, beauty treatments, powder, perfume, and other items.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a rice farmer who is married with three children.  He has been a farmer for the past 10 years, and he learned rice farming from a formal training program.

He will use his Kiva loan to pay for the labor costs of rice production such as nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs of his rice production

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: La Señora Sandra y su esposo el señor Elio llevan muchos años de casados, ellos viven en la zona de Oeste, de la Ciudad de Santa Cruz, cuenta con anticrético donde vive mas 3 años, la familia la componen con sus dos hijos, uno que estudia colegio y el otro es menor de edad. La Señora Sandra es una cliente con buenos antecedentes crediticios,  Se dedica a la producción de Colchones de paja de 2 plazas y 1 1/2 plaza. Lo comercializa en el Mercado la Ramada, ella entrega en un promedio por semana de 20 colchones. Su marido también trabaja en la producción de colchones. El financiamiento es para compra de material de construcción para ampliar su Tinglado (almacén) y poder producir mas colchones y tener stock y que su mercadería se encuentre protegida de los cambios climaticos (Lluvia, Sol, Ventarrones, etc.).
texts.en:
Sandra and her husband, Elio, have been married for many years. They live in the city of Santa Cruz’s Oeste zone.  They have an anticrético (a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) and have been living there for over three years.  The family is composed of her two children, one in secondary school and the other who is a minor.

Sandra is a client with good credit history.  She manufactures straw mattresses in two sizes that she sells at the La Ramada market.  She sells on average 20 mattresses weekly. Her husband also manufactures mattresses.

The loan is to buy building materials and supplies to expand her storage shed and be able to produce more mattresses to have in stock and so that her merchandise will be safe from changes in the weather (rain, sun, wind storms, etc.)

loans.use: to build a storage shed.

loans.name: Silvana

texts.es:
Silvana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos.  Cuenta con estudios superiores.
Trabaja con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace seis años, su primer préstamo fue  de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de productos artesanales.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de  S/.  2,500.00 nuevo soles, comprará veinte mallas para la pesca, dice que las compra en Juliaca y las vende en la localidad de Ilave.  Ella es profesora, pero tiene este negocio para poder solventar sus gastos y ahorrar para su futuro.
Su sueño es tener más capital para ser una empresaria exitosa.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son  las reuniones, la puntualidad y la responsabilidad de cada una.
texts.en:
Silvana is a member of the “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli” community bank which is located in Juli district, in Chucuito province, in Puno department.  She is 25 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  She completed her higher education.

Silvana has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling handicrafts.

Silvana will use this new loan for 2,500 soles to buy twenty fishing nets.  She says that she buys them in Juliaca and sells them in Ilave.  Silvana is a teacher but she has this business so that she can cover her expenses and save for her future.

Silvana's dream is to have more capital available so that she can become a successful businesswoman.

What Silvana enjoys about her community bank are the meetings, the punctuality and the responsibility.

loans.use: to buy twenty fishing nets

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Married to a driver, Hajara has three children. 

She makes palm oil for retailers.  Hajara assists her partner when it comes to taking care of their family and home. 

The loan will be used to buy more palm fruits to make more oil.  The profit will be reinvested into her small business for further growth.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruits to make more oil.

loans.name: Ranokhon

texts.ru: Раънохон женщина - предпринимательница. Она занимается самостоятельно этим бизнесом уже 10 лет. Раънохон  приобретает товар из других рынков города и продает на местном рынке. Она начала бизнес с малого количества женской обуви и постепенно расширяла поле  деятельности. У нее имеется своя торговая точка, где она занимается  бизнесом. Раънохон замужем имеет  2 детей, также у нее на иждивении два родителя. Она заботливая мать и жена, она старается улучшить условия жизни своей семьи, а для этого ей нужно расширить бизнес и получить прибыль. Раънохон для помощи обратилась к вам за помощью, ей нужно  получить займ в размере 1500$ США. Она надеется, что вы ей поможете  развить бизнес, путем предоставления займа и заранее благодарит за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Ranokhon is a female entrepreneur. She has been running her business independently for the last 10 years. Ranokhon purchases goods from central markets and sells them locally. She started her business from a small number of shoes she offered for sale and has slowly expanded her inventory. Now she has a market stall from which she runs her business. Ranokhon is married and has two children, and is also taking care of her elderly parents. She is a caring wife and mother and wants to improve her family's living condition. For this reason Ranokhon wants to expand her business and earn additional profit. She has turned to Kiva for help as she needs to take out a loan of 1500 US dollars.
