She is hoping that you will be able to help her improve her business by loaning money to her and she is grateful for your help and support.

loans.use: to purchase goods and expand her business

loans.name: Catalino

texts.es:
Catalino tiene 38 años, y vive con su esposa en la casa que ambos construyeron hace dos años. Catalino trabaja como jornalero durante la epoca de sequia (Noviembre a Junio), y como agricultor durante el resto del año (epoca de lluvia). Su esposa se dedica a la venta de medicina de botiquín (que no necesita receta médica) de comunidad en comunidad.

Durante la epoca seca (aproximadamente 9 meses del año), Catalino depende de su empleo como jornalero en una finca ganadera. En dicho empleo gana entre $6 a $8 dólares diarios. Durante la epoca de cultivo, Catalino cultiva un maximo de 7,000 metros cuadrados. Él cosecha lo suficiente para la alimentación de su familia, y deja una porción para la venta. De las ganancias de la venta, Catalino compra todos los insumos necesarios para su cultivo. El año pasado Catalino recibió un préstamo de Fundación Campo para cultivar maíz, y el cumplió con los pagos responsablemente.

Actualemente Catalino pidió un prestamo a Fundación Campo para colocarle energia electrica a su casa, al igual que para construir una cerca perimetral para su parcela agrícola. Hace dos años Catalino y su esposa construyeron su casa de adobe (tierra o barro crudo). Con la ayuda del préstamo Catalino podra tener energia electrica en su casa por primera vez en su vida. Con la energia eléctrica él podra tener otros electrodomesticos para preparar y guardar alimentos, al igual que darle mayor seguridad a su casa al estar iluminada por las noches. De igual modo el inmueble subirá en valor con acceso a dicho servicio.

En un futuro Catalino quiere comprar un refrigerador, y una cocina o una plancha pupusera (para hacer pupusas, platillo típico de El Salvador). Por la ubicación estratégica de su vivienda, Catalino desea tener una pequeña tienda y venta de pupusas. De esta manera su esposa no tendrá que viajar tan lejos para trabajar, y ellos podran tener otra fuente de ingresos para vivir dignamente.
texts.en:
Catalino is 38 years old and lives with his wife in a house that they built two years ago. Catalino works as a laborer during the dry season (November to June) and as a farmer during the rest of the year (which is during the rainy season). His wife sells over-the-counter medicines in their community.

During the dry season (which lasts approximately nine months), Catalino depends on his job as a ranch hand. In this job, he earns between $6 to $8 per day. During the farming season, he cultivates 7000 square meters of land. He grows enough to feed his family and has a portion left over to sell. The profit from what he sells is used to buy all the supplies he needs for farming. Last year, Catalino received a loan from Fundación Campo for growing corn. He completed his payments responsibly.

He is now requesting a loan from Fundación Campo in order to install electricity in his house. In addition, he will build a fence along the perimeter of his farmland. Two years ago, Catalino and his wife built a house out of adobe (earth or crude clay). With the help of this loan, Catalino will be able to have electricity in his house for the first time in his life. As a result, he will be able to have appliances for preparing and preserving food. In addition, his home will have greater security because he will have lighting at night. Since his property will have access to this service, it will increase in value.

In the future, Catalino wants to buy a refrigerator, a stove, and a griddle for making “pupusas” (a traditional dish in El Salvador). Since his home is in a strategic location, Catalino wants to open a small store and start selling “pupusas” so that his wife will not have to travel far in order to work. They will also have another source of income that will allow them to live decently.

loans.use: to install electricity in his home and to build a fence around his farmland.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es: Socorro vive con su hijo el cual aun asiste a la escuela, residen en una zona muy concurrida D. personas, donD. ella posee una tortillería y una pequeña tienda con la que sostiene su hogar, se ha hecho D. mucha clientela últimamente pues Socorro venD. las tortillas más ricas del lugar, además los productos que ofrece en su tienda son D. muy buena calidad y a excelentes precios;  Socorro es toda una trabajadora llena D. metas por alcanzar, para ella el entusiasmo es un elemento vital para el éxito es por eso que con mucho ánimo le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, producto instantáneo, maíz por mayor entre otros. Socorro tiene fe que D. esta forma con su trabajo duro lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Socorro lives with her son, who goes to school. They live in a very busy part of town, where she has a tortillería (a place where she makes and sells tortillas) and a small grocery store. Socorro and her son live on the money she makes from these enterprises. She has built up a great customer base of late, because she makes the best tortillas around, and the goods she sells in the store are good quality at excellent prices. Socorro is a hard worker through and through, always striving for the next goal. For her, enthusiasm is the vital ingredient for success, and so it is with great enthusiasm that she is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL. The loan will enable her to buy flour and rice, candies, bread, instant meals, among other things, and corn, which she buys in bulk. Socorro has faith that with her hard work she can improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy staples such as flour and rice, as well as candies, bread, instant meals, and corn.

loans.name: Naghma's Group

texts.en:
Naghma is 49 years old and married. She is a housewife, very efficient in manners and performs her duties very well. She has given birth to eight children. One of them is studying while others do different kinds of work to financially contribute to the family. 

Her husband has a spare parts shop in the market.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s spare parts business. With the loan, he will purchase different brands of spare parts for his shop that will allow him to make more sales and increase his profits.
 
Naghma is very confident that an investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and increase his income, and her family will be able to enjoy a better life as a result.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for selling.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is 30 years old. She is married and has two children. They are still small. She and her husband have a computer shop. They buy and sell computers (old and new). They have had this business for five years. They have a monthly income of about 7,000,000 Vietnam dong (VND). 

Since 2007, Mrs Thanh has participated in SEDA. The last time she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more computers and other things for her shop.

loans.use: to buy more computers and other things for her shop.

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Thoeun, 55, is married and has five children, three of whom are dependent. One of them is still in school while the other two work at the rice field and plantation. To make a living, she has been farming on her rice field for 30 years. She alS. plants cassava and raises pigs to generate additional income to feed her children. Currently, she can earn less than seven US dollars per day.

This is her first loan with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan to buy cassava trees for her plantation. She hopes that this loan will enable her to make more cassava and earn more income to feed her family better and alS. keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy cassava trees for her plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy is 58 years old and has 4 adult children. She is a member of the An Tap cluster. Thuy's main job is farming. She grows rice and breeds pigs, earning a monthly income of about 2,500,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2008. She borrowed 6,048,000 VND in her last loan and repaid it punctually. In this loan cycle, Thuy would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy pig feed.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients and utensils for her restaurant business.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years. Josephine earns extra income from pig-fattening.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda runs a sari-sari store -- a small retail shop -- where she sells snack foods, spices, coffee, milk, sugar and beverages. She is 41 years old, married and has one child. Her husband is an overseas Filipino worker in Saipan.

Imelda wishes to expand the variety products she offers to customers at her shop. Her goal is to earn a higher income so she is better able to sustain her family's basic needs. According to her, if her business becomes stable and profitable, her husband may no longer have to work abroad. She always prays that someday she and her child will live with her husband.

Imelda is requesting a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional items to sell such as noodles, bread, beans and canned goods.

loans.use: to buy items such as noodles, bread, beans and canned goods for resale at a small retail shop

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 51-year-old married man. He has six children whose ages range from seven years to 25 years. He describes himself as social and talkative. He operates a retail store where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 32 years. His business is located near a busy market. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy more clothes. His business goal is to run a boutique within five years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Farouk

texts.en:
Farouk is a 29-year-old father of three who subsists on farming in Kyenjojo in the west of Uganda. He has now been in this business for four years. He is happily married.

Farouk grows mostly bananas and pineapples. The future looks bright for his business. The number of food-sales businesspeople flooding his district has increased in the last seven years. That means farmers like him can look forward to selling more of their produce.

Week in, week out, this business generates him sales revenue to the tune of UGX 30,000. He hopes to use his loan to purchase better manure to apply in his farms. He anticipates better harvests at length.

loans.use: to purchase better manure to apply in his farms.

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en: Anastasie is a Cameroonian, married with four children, living in a rural area. The oldest child is 12 and in secondary school and the youngest is three years old and in nursery school. Anastasie has been in this business for the past ten years which makes her very experienced, stable and successful. I think she is going to succeed because of her long experience in this business. This being her first loan from us, she will use this money to increase her stock by 25 percent and her output by 45 percent as well as increasing her living standard.

loans.use: buy textilesand materials for the making of clothes

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND est composé de trois  personnes qui  sont dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Madeleine (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 49 ans a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Madeleine est mariée à un agent de transit du nom de Thomas. Le couple à deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Madeleine  vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. C’est pour cette raison, que Madeleine vend des tissus et des chaussures depuis quinze ans.  Madeleine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Madeleine ensemble avec les membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND sollicite pour la cinquième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés

loans.use: Acheter de tissus et des chaussures.

loans.name: Luis E

texts.en:
Luis emigrated from Cuba to the USA a few years ago. 

After working many years for other people, Luis developed his own brand and found a niche for a new Mexican line products call Ksabor.

This loan will allow him to print all the marketing materials for his new venture and will position his company in a better place to compete on the market.
 
He needs help to be able to make the two-year mark that is required for all businesses to access commercial lenders.

loans.use: To start a Mexican line of products.

loans.name: Muvakani Mbukilye S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Josephine. She is fifty two years old, married and a mother of five children. She is a member of Muvakani Mbukilye S.H.G which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in order to benefit from enterprise development and financial management training.

She does maize, beans and poultry farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides. This will greatly boost her farming hence increased income which will enable her cater for her children’s clothing, food and school fees.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides hence more income to cater for her children's clothing, food and school fees.

loans.name: Namo

texts.en:
Having more than five children in Samoan family is not a good result in some parents, especially in rural area but Namo M. from the village of Solosolo has tried her best for her five kids, she joined SPBD Programme in 2004. She had training with Tourism Authority for only two weeks based on small businesses and since then has used her loans from SPBD for her taro plantation, vegetable garden and donut business. 
Namo is pictured in front of her beach fales which are in the background. She wishes to use her Kiva loan to build another fale.

loans.use: Purchase timber and roofing for beach fale

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Mavis sells used clothing. She is a hardworking and trustworthy client of Kraban Support Foundation. She wants a Kiva loan of $750.00 to enable her buy more bales of clothing.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Koudjo

texts.fr:
Mr. Koudjo D. was born on January 11, 1974 in Danyi Elavanyo in the Kloto prefecture. He is married and a woodworker living in Lomé in the Golfe prefecture. Being from a poor family, Mr. Koudjo D. has trouble fulfilling his family duties because his income level is very low. Finding himself in this difficult position, he does not have the means to build furniture to attract customers.

He is thus not very well known in his neighborhood for his work. Mr. D. is asking for financing in the amount of $1200 to satisfy his clients and meet his family’s needs.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur D. Koudjo est né le 11 janvier 1974 à Danyi Elavanyo dans la préfecture de Kloto. Il est marié et est menuisier demeurant à Lomé dans préfecture de Golfe. Issue d’une famille très pauvre, Monsieur D. Koudjo n’arrive pas bien à remplir ses devoirs envers sa famille car son niveau de revenu est très faible. Se trouvant dans ce conflit, il n’a pas de moyens pour confectionner des meubles pour attirer les clients.

Ainsi il n’est pas bien connu dans le quartier de part son métier. Monsieur D. demande alors un fonds de financement d’une valeur de $1200 pour bien satisfaire ses clients et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of wooden boards

loans.name: Odilio

texts.es:
Mr. Odilio is married and the father of a 4-year-old boy who is about to start school. He is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of sand, cement, crushed rock, colouring and other materials for the production of blocks, decorative bricks, cobbles and other construction supplies he offers at his business. He hopes the loan will allow him to increase sales and improve the financial situation of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Odilio es casado y padre de un niño de 4 años que está a punto de entrar a la escuela. El está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de arena, cemento, piedrín, colorantes y otros materiales que le permiten elaborar bloques, ladrillos decorativos, adoquines y otros materiales de construcción que ofrece en su negocio. Espera que el crédito le permita incrementar sus ventas y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia.

loans.use: purchase of raw materials for the production of construction supplies.

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Mrs. Ou L., age 42, is a market vendor selling grocery products to earn about $3 per day in revenue. Her husband is a taxi driver earning about $5 per day in revenue. They have four children, two of whom are students and two of whom are married and no longer living at home.

In order to expand her business to meet customer demand, Mrs. Ou L. would like to borrow $1000 to purchase additional grocery products for her stand. She will also use part of the loan to finance the purchase of another taxi for her husband to drive, to replace the old car he was using. She is pictured here with one of her daughters.

loans.use: To buy additional products for her grocery business and purchase a new taxi for her husband's business

loans.name: Betsabet

texts.es:
We find Betsabet, a separated mother of two children, In the home of her mother. She is making her beautiful embroidery on the suits for a popular dance. Thanks to her patience, creativity and enthusiasm, she is very well known for her work. Betsabet's goal is to have a small shop and grow her income to improve the quality of life for her children. To reach this goal, she is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary materials (thread, needles, etc) to continue making her elegant suits so that she can grow her business and one day open a shop for embroidery as well as custom made suits for her clients. Let's help this young mother so she can continue creating her unique pieces with much love and care, and achieve her goal of helping her children.

En el domicilio de su querida y adorable madre encontramos muy laboriosa a doña Betsabet, madre separada de dos niños, realizando sus hermosos y finos bordados de los trajes típicos de la danza de la diablada (danza muy popular de su ciudad), trabajo al que gracias a su paciencia, creatividad y entusiasmo la han hecho muy conocida dentro de su entorno laboral.El deseo de Betsabet es poseer su tiendita de bordados de disfraces a fin de incrementar sus ingresos para incrementar el nivel de vida de sus queridos pequeños y para concretar este sueño ella recurre a tu apoyo desinteresado y solicita un préstamo de dinero que le permitirá comprar materiales (tela, lentejuelas, etc.) para seguir confeccionando sus elegantes trajes, para cumplir su sueño de poseer un espacio para bordar también disfraces a petición de sus clientes.Ayudemos a esta joven madre para que siga bordando con mucho amor y cariño hermosos e incomparables trajes y los sueños de sus pequeños.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIALS NEEDED TO EMBROIDER BEAUTIFUL TRADITIONAL SUITS.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: My name is Robina, a resident of Lahore. I am the mother of five children, aged between 8 to 21 years. I did a course of midwife twelve years ago and started practicing as a midwife to earn my living. My husband Munir Ahmed sells fruit. We need a loan of $250, to purchase fruit for the business. I intend to fulfill my liabilities in a good way, such as through marriages of my daughters, so that is why I and my husband both work very hard.

loans.use: Buy fruit for the business

loans.name: Kinaawa D(Ii) Group

texts.en:
Florence is 29 years old and married with three children. She has a bakery business. With the extra busines profits she earns, she wants to buy iron sheets for her residential house, which is currently under construction. Annet, Sarah, Viola and Joyce have beauty salon businesses. They want to use the loan to expand their salons.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Tres Pinos 2 Group

texts.es:
Martha was born in Ocosingo and is 43 years old. She has been sewing since she was 6 years old, making all kids of clothing. With this business she has been able to provide for her children. With the current loan she wishes to buy supplies to make her clothing (thread, fabric, needles, buttons). The other members of the group are: Rosa S. C. who has a grocery store, Maria G. V. who buys and sells bread, Maria de los Angeles L. Hernandes who is going to start a clothing selling business, Maria del Socorro D. who sells prepared food.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

DOÑA MARTHA COMO TODOS LA CONOCEN EN OCOSINGO TIENE 43 AÑOS DE EDAD, DESDE LOS 6 AÑOS DE EDAD SE DEDICA A LA COSTURA, CONFECCIONA TODO TIPO DE ROPA, CON ESTE OFICIO HA PODIDO SACAR ADELANTE A SUS 4 HIJOS, CON EL CREDITO DECEA COMPRAR MATERIAL PARA REALIZAR SU TRABAJO(HILOS, TELAS, AGUJAS, BOTONES), LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON, ROSA S. C. TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES, MARIA G. V., COMPRA Y VENDE PAN, MARIA DE LOS ANGELES L. HERNANDES VA A INICIAR VENTA DE ROPA, MARIA DEL SOCORRO D., VENDE COMIDA TIPICA(ANTOJITOS).

loans.use: Buy supplies (thread, needles, buttons, fabric).

loans.name: Imad

texts.en: Imad lives and works in the Beirut suburbs. Imad owns a bookstore. This is the sixth time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He needs $1000 to buy enough merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Ruth Belina

texts.es:
Ms. Ruth L. is 46 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of Managua. She is single and has two grown children who work in the tax-free economic development zones and help her out financially. She has managed to provide a better life for her children by selling homemade food and nacatamales (traditional Nicaraguan tamales) on the weekends for the last 30 years.

Now that she no needs to take care of her children, Ruth would like to open a small café. She is requesting a loan to buy foodstuffs for making food and nacatamales. (Nacatamales are a typical dish in Nicaragua that many families eat on the weekends.) Her current food sales help cover her expenses, but she doesn’t want to rely on her children anymore and has always liked to work.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Doña Ruth L., de 46 años de edad, habita en Laureles Norte, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos mayores que trabajan en Zonas Francas y le ayudan económicamente. Sacó a sus hijos adelante vendiendo durante 30 años comida casera y Nacatamales los fines de semana.

Ahora que no tiene más obligación con sus hijos quiere poner un cafetín. Solicita un crédito para comprar insumos de alimentos para elaborar sus comidas y nacatamales que es un plato típico de nuestro país el cual muchas familias acostumbran comer los fines de semana, con esta venta esta señora se ayuda en sus gastos ya que no quiere ser carga de sus hijos y siempre le ha gustado trabajar.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs for preparing food

loans.name: Blanca Esthela

texts.es:
Blanca started her business because she needed the additional income. Her husband does not have a steady job, and she needed to pay tuition for her 3 children. Five years ago, she started selling cosmetics by catalogue, then she included lingerie. Until now, her business has prospered. Her eldest daughter, Laura, helps her to sell the products and collect payments.

She needs a loan of $400.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to expand her business space. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca inició el negocio por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional al que le proporciona su esposo ya que el no tiene un trabajo fijo y necesitaba pagar las colegiaturas de la escuela sus 3 hijos comenzó su negocio hace 5 años, ofreciendo cosmeticos por catalogo, despues agrego leneceria y hasta la fecha le ha ido muy bien, su hija mayor Laura le ayuda a vender y cobrar a los clientes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para poder ampliar su negocio. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: Remodel business space

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mrs. Kong T., 56, is a widow with five children. Her husband died four years a go. All of her children are married, two of whom live in the family house about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Kong has been selling fishes for thirty years. She buys them from her nearby district about twenty kilometers from her house for resale at Kandal market in Phnom Penh. Kong is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to purchase a motorcycle to carry fishes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle to carry fishes for resale.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha is from San Juan de Loro, in the Sandia province. She first became a mother at a very young age. Since that time she has been buying and selling second-hand clothing, which she buys by packs in the town of Juliaca, and sells in the Rinconada mine, where her husband works.

Currently Bertha lives with her two young children in Juliaca. She wanted to stay at home longer to look after her children, so Bertha took on the business of raising cuyes (guinea pigs.) She would like to buy more cuyes to make her business grow; she is asking for your help to make this happen. With your support, this young woman's project and her children's future will bloom.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Bertha es natural del distrito de San Juan de Loro, provincia de Sandia, tomó la responsabilidad de ser madre a muy corta edad, desde entonces se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa de segundo uso, mercadería que adquiere por fardos en la ciudad de Juliaca y la vende en la mina Rinconada, lugar donde su esposo trabaja obrero. Bertha actualmente vive con sus dos menores hijos en la ciudad de Juliaca. Con el fin de estar más cerca de sus pequeños y estar al pendiente de sus necesidades decidió dedicarse a la crianza de cuyes, negocio con el que desea crecer, Bertha pide tu apoyo desinteresado para aumentar la cantidad de sus animalitos.Apoyemos a esta joven madre a concretar sus proyectos y forjar el futuro de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of cuyes (guinea pigs) to raise and sell

loans.name: Zebonisso

texts.ru:
Zebonisso H. lives in the Vakhsh district. She is 33 years old, married, and has three children. She works at the Kurgan-Tube city market, selling cottonseed oil. She buys from the oil factory in the city Dushanbe and brings it to Kurgan-Tube to sell at a profitable price. Still, she does not set her prices too high; they are the lowest in the market, and because of that she has the most customers. She does not have enough goods to satisfy everyone, so she decided to increase sales volume by taking out a loan. She will repay the loan in 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Ходжакулова Зебониссо жительница Вахшского района. Возраст 33 года , замужем и имеет троих детей. Работает на рынке города Курган-Тюбе. Торгует хлопковым маслом. Закупает на масложирном комбинате города Душанбе и привозит в Курган-Тюбе продавать по выгодной цене. Но Зебониссо ставит наценку не большую , поэтому цены у нее самые низкие и по этой причине у нее много клиентов. Для того , чтобы обслужить всех у нее не хватает товара , поэтому она решила увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales turnover

loans.name: Phath

texts.en: Phath S., 33, is a true entrepreneur and resides with her little child in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2005, she has had a business selling groceries and many kinds of vegetables to earn a living. She is able to make around US$5 in profit each day. In her village, there are many vendors who operate the same type of business as hers, so she needs to diversify her products to satisfy her customers. Currently, she is requesting a loan from Kiva via Credit, Kiva’s Field Partner, to increase her inventory of groceries and vegetables. In the future, she plans to breed pigs for extra profit to support the family. (Phath's mother is pictured because she was not available.)

loans.use: To increase her stock of groceries and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nely Edit

texts.es:
Nely es socia del Banco Comunal Llamkasum que significa Trabajemos en Quechua. Nely es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos de 5, 7, 12 años, Nely vende comida en su casa que esta implementado como un recreo, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde, la especialidad de Nely es la preparación de comida típica de la zona, también vende bebidas, los demás días de la semana vende bebidas en su tienda ubicada en el mismo lugar. Además Nely brinda servicios de preparación de comida para diferentes compromisos, eventos para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de su hermana.

Nely necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de vajilla, ollas, arroz y azúcar. Nely sueña con tener un local propio, implementar un restaurante, casarse y sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Nely is a member of the Community Bank "Llamkasum," which means "we work" in Quechua. Nely lives with her partner, 39 years old, and has 3 children who are 5, 7, and 12 years old. Nely sells food from her home that she implements like a recreation, since she works on Saturdays and Sundays from 6 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon. Nely's specialty is preparing food typical of the region. She also sells drinks. The rest of the week she sells beverages from her store also in her home. In addition Nely provides food preparation services for different events, for which she relies on help from her sister. Nely needs a loan of $500 that she will invest in the purchase of dishes, pots, rice and sugar. Nely dreams of having her own store, opening a restaurant, getting married and that her children will be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dishes, pots, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Ananias

texts.en:
Greetings from Ananias K. in Gikongoro, the southern province of Rwanda! Ananias is 44 years old, married with 5 children and 1 adopted children from the Genocide of 1994.

Ananias and his wife have been running their restaurant business for a number of years. This family gets up very early at 5 am, goes to the local market to buy foods like potatoes, carrots, beans, beef, onions, and tomatoes to prepare meals for the customers. They sell the food to the local residents who work in this small town. They employ 3 people in the business who help them to cook and serve food to the customers.

Besides owning a restaurant, Ananias sells stones for concrete for building houses, which earns him about US$ 110 per month. Ananias has been able to buy a plot of land in Gikongoro town and he hopes to build a commercial building to rent out on this plot. He is looking for a loan worth 400,000 Frws to buy more equipment for the restaurant: tables, spoons, plates, and cooking pots to meet the demand of his growing clientele. This loan will be repaid over 7 months.

loans.use: To buy more equipment for his little restaurant

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es: Eufemia tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo Cléber, el cual se dedica a ser chofer, y sus tres hijos Lucero de 12, Fernando de 9 y Anali de 3. En bienestar de su familia y de aportar a su hogar, optó por alquilar su patio como cochera, obteniendo buenos ingresos y pudiéndolo realizar desde su casa mientras cuida de sus pequeños. El espacio va quedando chico, ya que Eufemia guarda muchos carros, es así que quiere ampliar su patio, para lo cual recurre a nuestra ayuda para hacer de sus sueños una realidad. Eufemia se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado expandirá su patio para albergar mayor cantidad de coches.
texts.en:
Eufemia is 32 years old and lives with her husband Cléber, who works as a chauffer, and their three children, Lucero, age 12, Fernando, age 9, and Anali, age 3. For the wellbeing of her family and to support her household, Eufemia chose to rent her patio out as a parking lot, which allows her to make money from her home while caring for her children. The space is small, and many cars park in the lot, so she would like to expand the patio. She has appealed to us for our help in making her dreams reality. This is Eufemia’s first loan through Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. With the loan she will expand her patio in order to park more cars.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her patio, which she uses as a parking lot

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea V. is 49 years old who lives in Kandal Province, where she owns and runs a medium-sized shop that makes Khmer Noodles. She has one employee who helps her meet customer demand. Her company is doing very well, with many regular customers, and she earns about $20 a day. She has been in this line of work since 2003, and her income helps support her six children, four of whom are single and two of whom are married. Two of her children are employed; one sells groceries, and the other helps with this business.  V. has applied for a loan to expand her business by buying more rice that she can use to make noodles.

loans.use: To buy more rice to make noodle for sale

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
JUANA ISABEL F. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad ”, ubicada en el Jr. Huancayo Mz. A, Lt. 04 del Asentamiento Humano “Nuevo Bolognesi” de la C.F.B. km. 7.00 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 35 años de edad, 01 hija, es madre soltera, como socia 03 años en Manuela Ramos.

El primer préstamos que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró cuyes, carnero, hizo sus corralitos, los criaba, luego los vendía cuando crecían. Debido a que su granja estaba muy lejos y no tenía tiempo de verlos, le robaban, decidió dejar de criar.

Con este préstamo de S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró balones de gas industrial como oxígeno, distribuye en la ciudad a diferentes lugares.

Esta muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos por apoyarle, ya que ella es madre soltera y le brindó la ayuda en el momento que más necesitó.
texts.en:
Juana Isabel F. C. belongs to the "La Amistad" Communal Bank, located in the Bolognesi District. She is 35 years old, and is a single mother with one daughter. She has been a partner with Manuela Ramos (CrediMujer) for 3 years.

The first loan she received was for S/.300.00 Peruvian Soles, with which she bought guinea pigs and rams, made corrals, and cared for the animals, and sold them once they grew. Because her flock was very far way and as she was not able to constantly watch them, they were stolen, and she decided to stop raising animals.

With this loan of S/.3,000.00 Peruvian Soles, she would like to buy tanks of industrial gasses like oxygen, and distribute them to different places throughout the city. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos, a Kiva Partner, for her support, since she is a single mother


Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tanks of industrial gasses to distribute

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa Koné a 43 ans, célibataire et père d’un enfant, il réside dans une grande famille traditionnelle avec ses cadets à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Koné est un chauffeur de profession, parallèlement à son métier il mène l’activité d’achat et de vente des fournitures de bureau et  des meubles de maison depuis maintenant 15 ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité par sa clienèle  pour la qualité de ses produits.
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant quatre  mois. Il est à son premier prêt individuel .
 Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter, 4 armoires, 4 lits, 2 bibliothèques, etc. Il achète ses marchandises au cours de ses voyages en Côte d’Ivoire et au Togo avant de les revendre à la demande de sa clientèle.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et rembourser les intérêts du prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa Koné, age 43, is unmarried and the father of a child. He lives in a large traditional family with his younger siblings in Hamdallaye, one of the working-class districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He is a driver by trade. Along with this work, he has been buying and selling office supplies and home furniture for fifteen years. He is in high demand by his customers for the quality of his goods.

To satisfy his continually growing number of customers, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso four months ago and is on his first individual loan. With this loan, he plans to buy 4 armoires, 4 beds, 2 bookshelves, etc. He does his buying on trips to Côte d’Ivoire and to Togo. The goods are sold by special order.

With this loan, he envisions realizing an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to augment his working capital, to help cover family expenses, and to repay the loan interest.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture (dressers, beds, buffets, bookshelves, etc.)

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en:
A. Sabohat is 41 years old. She is married and the loving mother of 4 children.

The difficult living conditions and the low wages forced her husband to leave for Russia to earn money. Sabohat breeds cattle. She buys the small cattle on the market at a low price, feeds them, and then resells them in the same market at a more profitable price. Her elder son also attends to this business. Sabohat works hard in order to make the business successful and generate stable income for the family. Today Sabohat is planning to purchase the cattle for her household for raising and further selling. For this purpose, she requests $300 US Dollars for the term of 9 months. Sabohat would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to manage the loan without violations and delinquency.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle for breeding and selling.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian tiene 22 años, es madre soltera de un hijo que es menor de edad y dependiente de ella. La misma cuanta con una librería que tiene montado en su propio domicilio. Tiene venta de todos tipos de útiles escolares como por ejemplo: cuadernos, libros, reglas, pinceles, correctores, cartulinas, entre otros.

Lilian se ha dedicado a este rubro por más de cuatro años y su local comercial se encuentra en su misma casa, dónde para esto, ella realizo algunas modificaciones para poder tener el espacio correspondiente para su salón comercial y taller.

Lilian, con las ganancias de su venta aporta a los ingresos de la casa, y junto con sus padres hacen frente a los gastos  familiares.

Lilian comenta que tiene bastante venta. Es por ello que desea adquirir mayor cantidad de materiales escolares ya que empiezan las clases, de este modo podrá abastecer la fuerte demanda que tiene en la zona donde sale a hacer su venta.
texts.en:
Lilian is a 22 year old mother of a minor, dependent child. She has a bookshop which she set up in her home. She sells all types of school supplies such as notebooks, books, rulers, paintbrushes, markers, and others. Lilian has been in this business for more than four years. Because the shop is in her home, she had to make some modifications to have the space required for her business. With the earnings from her sales she contributes to household expenses. Together with her parents she covers the family expenses. Lilian has enough sales. For this reason she would like a bigger quantity of school supplies. Now that school is starting she could take advantage of the strong demand in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy notebooks, cards, books, general school supplies.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en: Mrs. Riza C. is 33 years old and married to Pedro C., who is a fisherman. They are blessed with four children and live in Balanlinao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is a new member of the Paglaum MPC micro-finance program, and runs a small stand selling snacks. She is applying for a loan to buy more snack items to sell to her customers.  She hopes that the increased income made possible by this loan will allow her to better provide for her family's needs. Mrs. C.'s goal is to have her own canteen one day, and to be able to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, and spices to make snacks to sell her customers.

loans.name: Ana Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Ana G. se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos varios ofrecidos en su propia pulpería que posee en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua.

Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy esforzada que ha logrado salir adelante llevando el sustento a su humilde familia que tiene a su responsabilidad. Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de los productos por la razón de que se le han agotado y requiere invertir en ellos. Espera muy confiadamente en Ceprodel y son sus sueños desarrollarse en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana G. works in her own shop and sells various products in the municipality of Sandino, in Managua. She has been characterized as a very focused person who has succeeded in getting ahead, and carrying her humble family, which is her responsibility. Today she has gone to Ceprodel to obtain a loan in order to purchase products, as her stock has run out, and she needs to invest in more products. She has much hope in Ceprodel, and her dream is to develop her business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products

loans.name: Rukiya

texts.en:
Greetings from N. Rukiya, a 42-year-old married woman. She and her husband have four children: a 15 year old, a 1 year old and two orphans who are 16 and 17 years old. This family currently lives in the Nyakabanda sector, Nyarugenge district in Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda.

Mrs. N. does her operations in Nyarugenge district. In her business she sells women clothes and all kinds of shoes. Her husband is a driver and produces a monthly salary of approximately $275. She doesn't have any employees since she started this business in early 2007. From her business, N. earns $365 as monthly profit. The loan amount requested is 500000 Rwf.

This entrepreneur starts her business at 7 a.m and finishes at 7 p.m every day. With the loan, Mrs. N. intends to expand her business and with the increased profit, she will reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Iván

texts.es:
El señor Iván G. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales pago puntual mente.
En esté momento está solicitando nueva mente un préstamo para poder terminar los acabados del exterior de su casa ya que gran parte es para la seguridad de su familia. 
 Iván trabaja en una maquiladora en el departamento se sistemas, esté es el ingreso que tiene para su familia y con el cual una parte lo destinara para el pago del crédito.
Cuando se realizo le visita al domicilio del señor Iván G. el se encontraba trabajando horas extras, portal motivo la que nos entendió fue su esposa la señora Blanca Esthela García y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Iván G. has previously obtained loans from FVP, which he paid punctually. At this time, he is once again requesting a loan so that he can do finish work to his house’s exterior because it is mostly for his family’s safety.

Iván works in the IT department in an assembly plant. With this job, he is able to provide an income for his family, and some of the money will be used to repay the loan.

When we visited Mr. G.’s house, he was working overtime, which is why his wife, Blanca Esthela García, and their children welcomed us.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home exterior finish work

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew. She hawks in her community in the mornings. She wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. Ama buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for one year now.

Ama is 43 years old, married and has four children: two sons and two daughters. All are currently in senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Ama wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocio tiene 22 años, vive con su pareja, quien es afilador en una empresa maderera, ambos tienen una hijita de 2 añitos de edad y por el momento viven en la casa de sus suegros. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad (arroz, leche, pan, y otros productos de consumo básico), negocio que ha implementado en un espacio que le brindaron sus suegros, quienes la apoyan mucho. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es atender al público, por eso les da una buena atención, además esta actividad la mantiene activa. Ella considera que su negocio es rentable porque por su zona es la única persona que tiene este tipo de negocio y sus clientes se sienten satisfechos de contar con su negocio. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos sus compañeros comparten ideas y se apoyan entre sí. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a ampliar su negocio y ambientarlo adecuadamente para dar una mejor vista a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rocio is 22 years old and lives with her partner who is a knife grinder at a lumber business. Together they have a 2-year-old daughter and they currently live at their in-law’s house. For two years she has been selling groceries and basic necessities (rice, milk, bread, and other basic consumption products). She started this business in a space provided to her by her in-laws, who greatly support her. What she likes about her work is attending to the public, and because of that she gives them good attention; additionally, this work keeps her active. She considers her business to be profitable because in her neighborhood she is the only person that has this type of business and her customers feel satisfied in counting on her business. This is her fourth loan with MFP and what she likes about her village bank is that all of her companions share ideas with each other and support each other. With the money she’s asking for she will increase the size of her business and adequately liven up the environment to give her customers a better atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the environment of her store

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en: 43-year old, Ma. Fe C. is a farmer of vegetables and also helps her husband to manage a 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) rice farm. She has six children who are going to school. Aside from their expenses for food and electricity, she also worries about the school fees and books. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She wishes to buy the fertilizers and chemicals needed on her farm. She thinks that buying these things is very important in ensuring the healthy growth of the rice so as to have an abundant harvest. CEVI helps her sustain her small livelihood. She receives not just loans but education as well to help her small business grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 25-year-old single man.  Since 2007, he has been working in design and construction with his father to provide for the family's needs. Today, Abbas is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy wood for the business.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizing

loans.name: Ta Try Traders Group

texts.en:
This is Ya Kadday K., Fattie I., Mosses K. and Kadiatu K.. They named their group Ta Try Traders.  They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Magburaka, about fifteen miles from Makeni City in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan they will receive from Kiva Lenders through SMT. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and increase their sales-to-profit-margin. As such, their living standard will improve, they will be able to send their children to school, feed and clothe them.  

Ya Kadday K. (left) is the leader of the group. Ya Kaday is approximately fifty years of age. She was born in Magburaka town, where she currently resides together with her husband and five children. Ya Kaday sells used clothes and palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil). She has been a businesswoman since childhood days. Ya Kaday will invest this loan into her business.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu is 31, married and has two children, both of whom are in school in the community where they live. She is a food vendor and had sold banku with soup for the last two years. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is eaten with hot soup. She has many customers, since banku is enjoyed by many Ghanaians for breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her income to support her business and to help her children's education, and would like to expand to sell cereals in bags to her customers. She always saves part of her profit for unforeseen occurrences. She has two assistants who help in serving her customers with food and she pays them at the end of each day. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is fifty-five years old; she is a widowed mother of six children. One is currently in school whilest the rest are working. She believes in hard work, and she is dedicated to her work as a primary antidote to minimizing poverty. She owns and operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like 'fufu' and 'banku'. 'Fufu' is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains, and it is taken with hot pepper or soup.

Mary wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, etc.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 30 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Ibrahim has been working as a carpenter and a furniture repairer since 1999. He repairs old furniture and even produces new furniture; he furnishes rooms such as bedrooms and living rooms. Ibrahim requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new wood machine for his work. This is the first time that Ibrahim has requested a loan. 

Ibrahim is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and does a good job. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he had difficulty networking to build a client base and had some financial issues. Ibrahim decided to continue his business because he wanted to have an independent source of income. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new wood machine for his work.

loans.name: Ricardo Javier

texts.es:
Ricardo A. desde hace diez años se dedica a su actividad de siembra de ajonjolí en el departamento de León donde se esfuerza grandemente por mejorar las condiciones de su actividad para salir adelante y proporcionarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia compuesta por su pequeño hijo a su responsabilidad ya que él es un padre soltero.

Solicita un crédito para llevar a cabo la corta y emparve del ajonjolí y para esto requiere pagarle a mozos para sacar prontamente la cosecha y proceder con su respectiva comercialización para generar los ingresos para su desarrollo. Espera ser beneficiado con el crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su actividad.
texts.en:
Ricardo A. has been growing sesame for 10 years in the department of León. He greatly strives to improve his business in order to succeed and provide a better life for his family. Ricardo is a single father who is responsible for a young son.

He is requesting a loan in order to hire labor to cut the sesame stalks and thresh them for the seeds. This needs to be done before he can bring his crop to market and generate revenue for further development. Ricardo expects that this loan will improve the conditions for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for labor to harvest his sesame crop

loans.name: Mariela Esperanza

texts.es:
Mariela Esperanza es una socia dinámica y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 38 años, es madre de 4 hijos de los cuales uno es mayor de edad, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es soldador y se dedica a la venta de comida regional. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa y trabaja conjuntamente con sus hijos.
Mariela forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Divinas” desde hace un año; el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles que invirtió en pollos, para luego venderlos en el mercado Bellavista de la ciudad de Pucallpa. 
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles que utilizará en la compra de pollos para luego ser vendidos.La meta de Mariela es tener un local propio para su restaurant.
texts.en:
Mariela Esperanza is a dynamic and collaborative member who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is a 38-year-old mother of 4 children, one of whom is an adult. She relies on the support of her husband, who is a welder, and she works in the business of selling regional foods. Her business is located in her home and she works together with her children. Mariela has been a part of the "Las Divinas" Communal Bank for a year; she invested her first loan of 300.00 nuevos soles in chickens in order to later sell them at the Bellavista market in Pucallpa. Now she needs a loan of 800.00 nuevos soles, which she will use to buy chickens for sale. Mariela's goal is to have a site specifically for her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to buy chickens to sell at the Bellavista market in Pucallpa.

loans.name: Moutaerou Akansa

texts.fr:
Cet homme est un réparateur de motocyclettes, il dispose de son atelier au bord d’une route non loin d'un hôtel qui s'appelle "AVENIDA", ce qui lui permet de se faire remarquer par les clients dans le besoin ou qui ont des ennuis avec les roues de leurs motos. La machine à air qu’il utilise est en panne ce qui a ralenti un peu son activité. Il sollicite de WAGES son tout premier crédit pour acheter une nouvelle machine à air.
Il est marié et père de 02 enfants, c’est avec le revenu de son activité qu’il subvient financièrement  aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Moutaerou Akansa R. repairs motorcycles. His shop is located along a road, not far from the Avenida Hotal. This location allows him to be noticed by customers who are having problems with their motorcycles. The compressed air machine that he uses is broken and this loss is slowing down his business. He is requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy a new compressed air machine. He is married and the father of 2 children. The profits from his business will enable him to meet his family's expenses.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new compressed air machine

loans.name: Jursaa

texts.en:
Jursaa is 33 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Uvs province, Mongolia. His son and three daughters, who are between 12 and 18 years old, attend a local secondary school. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent.

With the help of his wife, Jursaa operates a meat trading business at a local market. He is responsible for purchasing and transporting meat and livestock from countryside residents and his wife is responsible for selling them. They sell a variety of meats to their customers at a stall in the local market. Jursaa started his business in 2000 and his business currently operates at a stable level and he continues to make progress.

Jursaa hopes to grow his business in the future and his continued success is very important as he must support his daughter, who is going to enter university next year. Jursaa is requesting a 900,000 tugrug loan to purchase more meat in order to increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase more meat for his business

loans.name: Scopas

texts.en:
Scopas L., currently in the business of selling green vegetables in the market, is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell. Scopas is 30 years old, married to a policeman, and has five children, all of whom attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Osana

texts.en:
Osana  T. is 38 and married with 5 children (ages 3 - 15).  She owns a business venture, selling ice-cakes (flavored ice in styrofoam cups).  Osana  has 3 years of experience in this business.  Osana  needs a loan of WST $1500 to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring).  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 280 tala or US $117 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Osana  joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Osana 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Osana  T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.3 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring)

loans.name: Carlos José

texts.es:
El  señor Carlos José C. C.  es obrero, casado,  Tiene dos hijos menores vive en el barrio la florida con su familia, trabaja como operario de limpieza en el tren de aseo desde hace nueve años en la Alcaldía de Chinandega.
El  señor Carlos C. tiene tres años de trabajar con  crédito en esta financiera con cuatro créditos. El señor C. ha demostrado responsabilidad y honestidad.
Siempre ha trabajado arduamente para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y para que a sus pequeños hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Carlos José C. C. is a laborer. He is married and they have two, minor children. They live in the La Florida neighborhood. He works as a cleaning crew member for Chinandega's municipal government. Mr. Carlos C. has collaborated with this financial institution for three years. He has demonstrated responsibility and honesty. He has always worked hard to support his home and so that his children wouldn't lack anything.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal expenses.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es:
La señora Julieta vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la zona Ernesto Torrez de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que ella realiza es la venta de ropa, con esta actividad ella mantiene a su familia y cubre todas sus necesidades.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más mercadería y poder mantener estable su negocio.

Es cliente de impro desde el año 2007 y tiene un historial de pagos muy bueno, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Julieta lives in her own house with her husband and children. They live in the Ernesto Terrez area of the city of La Paz. She sells clothes, and with this activity she supports her family and covers all of their necessities. The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital to buy more merchandise and be able to keep her business stable. She has been a client of Impro since 2007. She has a very good payment history, and she qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more clothes for her business of selling clothes

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La Señora Herminia S. G. tiene 36 años de edad, ella vive sola y sus 6 hijos los cuales son todos pequeños con edades de 15, 10, 8, 6, 4 y 2 años. Ellos viven en inmediaciones de Vilomilla en una zona agrícola de la Zona de Sipe-Sipe de la provincia de Quillacollo.

La Señora Herminia es una señora que se dedica a la agricultura,  y a la producción de leche cruda, la señora vive sola con sus hijos pues hace una año que su esposo la abandono, y desde entonces ella mantiene a su  numerosa familia. Herminia ordeña sus vacas todos los días a primeras horas y luego regresa su casa para alistar a sus hijos y llevarlos a su escuela, luego lleva a sus vacas a pastear, a entregar su leche para vender  y retorna a su casa para preparar el almuerzo para sus hijos; así todos los días tiene una actividad muy ardua. La señora Herminia es una señora que busca dar siempre una mejor vida a sus hijos, una mejor educación, salud y alimentación, todo lo que pueda en sus posibilidades darles, a pesar de que la vida fue muy dura con ellos desde que se fue su padre, los niños tienen sueños de estudiar y ayudar siempre a su mamá.

Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero de ese modo poder aumentar la producción de leche, y así poder incrementar más sus ingresos y poder ofrecer a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Herminia S. G., 36, lives alone with her six young children, who are 15, 10, 8, 6, 4 and 2 years old. They live near Vilomilla in a farming sector of Sipe-Sipe, Quillacollo province. Herminia is a farmer and also raises dairy cattle for raw milk production. She lives alone with her children because her husband abandoned her a year ago. Since then, she supports her large family by herself. Herminia milks her cows daily early in the morning. She then returns home to get her children ready for school and takes them there. Next, she takes her cows out to pasture, delivers the milk for sale and returns home to prepare lunch for her children. Thus her daily routine is hard work. Herminia is always looking to provide her children with a better life, a better education, nutrition and health; everything that is within her grasp to give them, even though life for them has been very hard since their father left. The children hope to study and always help their mother. She is asking for funding to buy another cow so that milk production will increase thereby increasing income so that she can provide a better standard of living for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy cows.

loans.name: July

texts.es: LA SEÑORITA JULY ES SOLTERA, ESTUDIANTE, TIENE SU TIENDITA DE BARRIO DONDE OFRECE PRODUCTOS DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD Y TAMBIEN REGALOS,  LA CUAL LE PERTENECIA A SU MAMA, CUANDO SU MAMA SALIA ELLA SE QUEDABA ATENDIENDO LA TIENDA  DESDE PEQUEÑA LUEGO SE PUSO A ESTUDIAR ADMINISTRACION DE EMPRESAS, CUANDO TENIA TIEMPO LIBRE SE HACIA CARGO DE SU TIENDA, AHORA ESTA TRABAJANDO EN EL CAFETAL COMO ASISTENTE DE GERENCIA. EL DINERO DEL CREDITO ES PARA EQUIPAR MAS SU TIENDITA COMPRO BOLOS SON HELADOS DE AGUA SIN LECHE YA QUE SON NOVEDOSOS EN ESPECIAL PARA LOS NIÑOS Y LLAMA LA ATENCION  YA QUE SON MUY RICAS Y  APETESIBLES, LA SRTA. ES UN AJOVENCITA TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
July is single and a student. She has a local store which belongs to her mother where she sells basic consumables and also gifts. Whenever her mother went out she looked after the store from when she was young. Later on she started studying business administration, and when she has free time she takes care of her store. Now she is working in a coffee plantation as management assistant. The loan money is to re-stock her store. She bought "bolos" - they are milkless ice blocks - as they are novelties especially for children and they get their attention since they are very rich and appetizing. She is a hard working and responsible young woman and she is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given by awarding the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Zenaida Maria

texts.es:
La  microempresaria: Zenaida Maria B. P. tiene 41 años de edad, es casada tiene 4 hijos, estos estudian en nivel primario y secundario en esta ciudad de Bluefields. Esta microempresaria tiene unos 7 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa usada, la que consiste en ropa para adultos, ropa para niños, ropa de cama entre otras.

Esta señora ya ha sido beneficiada con dos préstamos anteriores los cuales ha cancelado en tiempo y forma, actualmente esta solicitando un tercer préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en el mismo negocio. Además aprovecha para agradecer a los prestamistas que depositaron su confianza en ella y entregaron el dinero para que pudiera invertirlo.

Según la microempresaria este producto se vende bastante y lo que ella hace es tener clientes que le encargan el producto y de esta manera pude estar comprando y actualizando su inventario.

Esta solicitando se le financie para comprar lo siguiente: 1 paca de Ropa usada para niños a US 100 la paca, 2 pacas de sabanas usadas a US 200 cada paca,1 paca de  toallas usadas a US 100 la paca y1 paca de  ropa usada para adultos a US 200 cada paca.
texts.en:
The micro entrepeneur, Zenaida Maria B. P., is 41, married, and has 4 children who are primary and secondary school students in this city, Bluefields. She has been selling used clothing for 7 years: clothing for adults, children, and bed linens, etc. This lady has been the recipient of 2 previous loans which she paid off on time. Currently she is asking for a third loan to purchase inventory for the same business. Also she would like to take this opportunity to thank the lenders who have shown confidence in her, and lent money that she could invest in the merchandise. According to this micro entrepreneur, these items sell well. What Zenaida does is to have her customers request certain articles of clothing, and thus she can be buying and keeping her inventory up to date. She is asking for a loan to buy the following: 1 pack of used children's clothing at $100 US the pack, 2 packs of used sheets at $200 each pack, 1 pack of used towels at $100 the pack, and 1 pack of used adult clothing at $200 each pack.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing for children, used sheets, used towels, and used clothing for adults

loans.name: Mrs. Chanry Un Village Bank Group

texts.en: Seventeen people who live in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. They will all use the loan for different purposes to support their businesses in the future. Mrs. Chanry U. is the village bank president, and has been selected by all the members. She owns a general store, and earns some money from selling groceries. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it. Therefore, Mrs. Chanry U. is seeking a loan to buy more groceries to add inventory in order to increase her income this year and in the future. Her husband, Mr. Sophal Choem, has a trailer he uses for business. They support three children who are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to add inventory.

loans.name: Rukhsana Kousar's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana Kousar lives with her husband and one son in a two room brick house in Vehari, Pakistan. Her husband has been involved in the business of selling goats for the last 5 years. Rukhsana operates a domestic sewing business. She receives orders from her neighbors and gets reasonable compensation from them.

Rukhsana has applied for a loan for her husband, who wants to buy more goats for the expansion of his business. She is hopeful that by making an investment in his business, he will be able to make more money. This will help her to send her son to school, as he is not presently enrolled in a school due to financial constraints.

loans.use: to purchases goats for resale

loans.name: Vihoede Akouvi

texts.en: Vihoede K. is 45 years old and works as a seamstress out of her home in Lomé. As a widow with two children, she must work in order to provide an income for herself and her children. To create her dresses and other clothing, she must purchase sewing supplies like thread and fabric. It is for this reason she has requested a loan of 400,000 CFA.

loans.use: To purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa S. is 34 years old, married, and has 4 children. She owns a business venture, selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women). Epenesa has 1 year of experience in this business. Epenesa needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 150 talas or US $63 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Epenesa joined SPBD. This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Epenesa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD: 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics & materials.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty J., a 54-year-old married mother of three school-aged children, is from the town of Banga where she owns and operates a general store selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She also raises hogs for fattening and hopes to acquire more piglets.

Betty joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is requesting a new loan, her second, of 7000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell as well as feed and piglets. Betty plans to use the extra revenue generated from the business to improve her enterprise.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia S. is a widow who lives in Barangay Tiniguiban, Puerto Princesa, Palawan. She earns her living by operating four business ventures: a restaurant, a general store, a farm and a room-for-rent business. 

Inocencia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Inocencia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of 35,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of $675, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th cycle loan, she is borrowing 40,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase ingredients for the food she sells in her restaurant and to start a new business selling soft drinks wholesale. 

She works hard and wants to expand her business so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Inocencia S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the food she sells and capital for new wholesale soft drinks business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Maura Paula

texts.es:
Maura de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Hace 15 años atrás ella comenzó con su tienda de vivieres, uno de sus primeros productos fueron galletas y snack. Debido a la demanda de los víveres ella comenzó a comprar enlatados, arroz y aceite poco a poco con esfuerzo y después de separarse de su esposo amplio la tienda. Ahora trabaja con ayuda de sus dos hijos mayores desde las 07h30am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. 

Para poder surtir mejor su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, enlatados etc. En el futuro quiere surtir mejor su tienda y tener una papelería aquí llamada “Bazar”.
texts.en:
Maura is 43 and she lives on the outskirts of the Paraíso de Guayaquil area, characterized by unpaved and mountainous streets. 15 years ago she began with her general store and one of the first products were cookies and snacks. Due to the demand for the items she began to buy canned goods, rice and oil. Little by little, with effort and after separating from her husband, she enlarged the store. Now she works with the help of her two adult children from 7:30 am to 7:00 pm every day.
