To be able to better stock her store she wants to use the loan to buy rice, canned goods, etc. In the future she would like to have better merchandise in the store and to have a stationery shop called “Bazar” (Bazaar).

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: rice, canned goods

loans.name: Zablon

texts.en:
Zablon has been practicing mixed farming for the last 22 years and employs three farmhands. He has a mixed farm in Kisii, western Kenya that produces  maize, beans, tea and millet which he sells both locally and through the Kenya Tea Development Authority. He also depends on his monthly pension to cater for his family's basic needs.

Zablon is 54 years old. He is married with 5 children who are between the ages of 15 and 28. Four of the children attend school.

Zablon recently repaid his previous loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 70,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. He says the income from the sale of milk will help him pay his children's school fees and improve their livelihood. In the future, he would like to expand his dairy farming by acquiring 4 more dairy cows. His primary challenges are lack of enough animal feed, lack of qualified artificial insemination and lack of markets for his milk. He would like Juhudi to continue organizing trainings for the farmers.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa M. sells sugar in both small and large quantities at Abura. Theresa has received junior high education. She is divorced and takes care of her three children.  She responsibly sees to the general well-being of her family. Her loan will enable her to buy two bags of sugar to meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to use the new earning as a result of the loan to educate her children.

loans.use: two bags of sugar to meet the demand of her customers

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita A. is from Paliwan, Bugasong, Antique, Philippines.  She is a 63 years old, widowed, and has four adult children. Amelita regrets that all of her children did not finish their studies in college because she could not afford to send them to school.  When her husband died, Amelita had to be both mother and father to her children  During her ups and down in life, no one else was there to lean on and no one could support her.  Only her children give her inspiration to move on and face the different challenges in her life.  While she never loses hope to the trials that she meets in achieving her dreams, she continues to remind her children and grandchildren that education is very important because according to her education is the best weapon for poverty.

Amelita joined ASHI in 2008 because she still has a dream, which is to support her children so that her grandchildren will finish their studies. Her first loan was for PHP 5,000; for her second loan, she requested PHP 9,000, which she will use as additional capital for her variety store and vegetable vending.  Her income from this business is a great help to sustain the needs of the family. She is very thankful to ASHI because the institution gave her the opportunity to see that her dreams for her family come true.

loans.use: To acquire capital for her variety store and vegetable vending

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco A. is from the city of San Antonio, Ozamiz City. He is 57 years old. Francisco is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Francisco owns and operates a business that provides transportation services. Francisco has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Francisco joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisco has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle so that he can provide better service. This loan will be Francisco's fifth loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora del Carmen C. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora  quien es propietaria de una mueblería la cual inicio hace 25 años realizando sillas y pequeñas productos. Ella con el crédito comprara madera de laurel y cedro para realizar unos encargos. 
C. tiene dos hijos por los cuales desea salir adelante y crecer.
texts.en:
Aurora del Carmen C. is a hardworking, dedicated, enterprising woman who owns a furniture store she started 25 years ago making chairs and small items.  She will use the loan to buy laurel and cedar to complete some pending orders.

She has two children for whom she wants to get ahead and grow.

loans.use: For wood.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 33 años, convive con Sergio, de 38 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Roxana, de 17 y Reiner de 7 años de edad. En unión familiar, ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Ñagazu (selva central peruana). Está emprendedora mujer, todas las mañanas se dedica a los cuidados de sus sembríos de café, plátanos, y palta. Ya tiene  5 años dedicándose a la agricultura, gracias al buen cuidado y dedicación que le brinda constantemente a sus cultivos, cada cosecha agrícola, obtienen buenos resultados, según menciona su granos de café, los comercializa en la asociación “Apsi”, que formaron los agricultores de su localidad, Pero sus demás frutos, los vende en la ciudad de Villa Rica, a donde viaja constantemente. Ahora Sonia, está pensando sembrar, más cantidad de café y mejorar su calidad, asimismo quiere surtir su tienda de comestibles con la compra de gaseosas, dulces, y productos de primera necesidad. Esté es el segundo crédito con MFP, y como socia, nueva de su banco comunal, se compromete a no defraudar la confianza y el apoyo que depositan en ella. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará bolsas negras, para hacer su vivero de café, de la misma manera surtirá su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Sonia is 33 years old.  She lives with her partner, 38 year-old Sergio.  They have 2 children: 17 year-old Roxana and 7 year-old Reiner.  They live in their own home which is located in the indigenous community of Ñagazu (central Peruvian jungle).  This enterprising woman spends every morning caring for her coffee, banana and avocado crops.  She has been farming for 5 years and, thanks to the good care and attention which she constantly gives her crops, she obtains good results with each harvest.  She mentions that she sells her coffee beans in the 'Aspi' association which the farmers in her town set up.  She sells her fruit in the city of Villa Rica which she travels to constantly.  Now Sonia is thinking of planting more coffee and improving its quality.  She would also like to stock her grocery store by purchasing soda, sweets and basic household products.

This is Sonia's second loan with MFP and, as a new member of her community bank, she pledges not to let down the people who have placed trust in her and supported her.  She will use her loan to buy black bags for her coffee nursery.  She will also stock her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy products to stock her store and black bags for her coffee nursery

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.ru:
Vidadi Y. 57 let. On jenat i imeyet 4 detey dvoya iz kotorix uchatsya v kolledje i dva iz kotorix uchatsya v shkole. Vidadi yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli regiona i seychas jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. 

Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovoshi frukti dlya pereprodaji. Etomu biznessu prodaji fruktov ovoshey on nauchislay u svoyeqo otca ,Vidadi uje 8 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom.
texts.en: Vidadi Y., 57, is married with four children. Two of them children go to college and two are still in school. Vidadi is an internally displaced person whose family had to resettle from Fuzuli to Absheron. Vidadi is applying for a loan of 2000 AZN. This money would help him buy fruit and vegetables for retail sale. Having learned this trade from his father, Vidadi has been in this business for eight years.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables for retail sale

loans.name: Zanele Group

texts.en:
Bongisiwe is 32 years of age and married with four children between the ages of 1 and 12 years. She runs a blocks manufacturing business from her home. She also earns an income from the government's child support grant and has four dependents that she takes care of. 

She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy materials for making cement blocks. Bongisiwe would like to buy a tractor for her business in five years time. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her send her children to high school and university, and she hopes for a bright future.

She added that she will be faithful to KIva and WDB. She is the leader of her borrower group and is raising her hand in the photo above.

loans.use: To purchase material for making blocks

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
El señor Ramiro es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres ya hace mucho tiempo, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente trabaja manejando maquinaria pesada (un montacargas) en una empresa de construcción, de  la cual el dueño es su primo; Ramiro también se encarga aparte de los contratos de trabajo de la empresa.
El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de una computadora para su casa. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ramiro is single and he has no children. He has lived with his parents for a long time. The house is located in the community of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz. 

He drives heavy machinery (a front-end loader) for a construction company, of which his cousin is the owner. Ramiro is also responsible for the company's work contracts. 

The loan will be used to purchase a computer for home. This is how he earns an income for their household.

This is his first loan and his socio-economic analysis is positive and he is eligible to access a loan.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for his children.

loans.name: Chequita

texts.en:
Chequita D. is from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 63 years old. Chequita is widowed and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Chequita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods & toothpaste in the local community. Chequita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Chequita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chequita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Chequita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods & canned goods. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Chequita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like junk foods & canned goods.

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en:
Mwanamvua is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has operated a retail business for the past one year, operating from home to sell to her neighbors and passersby. Mwanamvua faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to operate a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase two sacks of rice and coconuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of rice and coconuts for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Legal costs to transition his business and purchase of accounting software

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en:
Josiane is 29 years old. She is married with four children between the ages of one and nine. She owns a business selling bananas and onions. Her business is open from 7am until 8pm every day. She has four years of experience in this business and she is currently employs one person to help her. 

Josiane has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of increasing her business by purchasing more bananas and onions to satisfy her customers. With any profits, she will pay school fees for her children and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas and onions to sell

loans.name: Humberto Jose

texts.es: EL SEÑOR  M.  LABORA COMO GUIRIZA , TIENE DOS HIJOS A SU CARGO,ES ACOMPAÑADO , ES  EL PRIMER  CREDITO  QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, AGRADERCE EL APOYO  BRINDADO DE  ESTA INSTITUCION  CON ESTE DESEMBOLSO QUE LE HAN APROBADO , ESTE CREDITO LO NECESITA PARA   COMPRAR MATERIALES COM O ARENA, BLOQUE,CEMENTO, HIERRO Y MANO DE OBRA PARA HACER ANEXO DE UN CUARTO..
texts.en: Mr. M. works for a water company. He has two children in his care and is married. This is the first loan that Kiva partner Ceprodel has authorized for him. He is grateful for the support that this organization is giving him for this expenditure. He needs this loan to purchase materials such as sand, bricks, cement, and iron, as well as to hire laborers in order to add a room to his house.

loans.use: to make home improvements

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama P. sells food items such as salt, tomatoes, pepper and others at Mfuom near Abura.  She is married to a farmer and they live together with seven dependents. She supports her husband to help feed and educate their dependents. She intends to use the proceeds of this loan to buy more food items for sale.

loans.use: to buy more food items for resale, such as salt, tomatoes, and pepper

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Mrs. Lay Y. and her husband Mr. Sophal Nou have three sons and four daughters. They live on an island in the Mekong River, approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Lay is a silk weaver and also assists her husband in his farming business when she is free. Her husband is a farmer and raises cows at home. She is asking for a loan of $700 to repair and relocate the house where she lives.

loans.use: To repair and relocate the house where she lives.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She sells household goods like sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, and detergents. Her major challenge in the business is stiff competition from other retail shop operators. She dreams of developing and expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of detergents, cereals and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of detergents, cereals and cooking oil.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
En el municipio de Managua, la señora Juana es una persona luchadora debido a que ha sabido llevar el bienestar a su casa para darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia. Ella se ha esforzado para ser el sostén de su hogar con buenos valores morales como persona.

Con este crédito que Ceprodel le ha otorgado agradece porque así les ha dado un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos, con este desembolso lo utilizara para comprar materiales como verjas y puertas para darle mejor seguridad a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana lives in the Managua municipality.  She is a tenacious person, and she has known how to watch out for the well-being of her household.  She does this in order to improve her family’s living conditions.  She has worked hard to support her home and to be a person with good moral values.

She is grateful for this loan from Ceprodel because it has given her children a better standard of living.  She will use this loan to buy materials like iron gates and doors in order to provide her house with better security.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve her home.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 40 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Homero de 47 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad diaria de Julia es la venta de carne, tiene su puesto en el mercado N° 2 (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Pucallpa), el cual es muy concurrido, ya que siempre vende carne de muy buena calidad, ella es una vendedora muy alegre y recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en los labios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poder salir, pero es parte del trabajo y del sacrificio para poder ganar más dinero. En  adelante desea tener una carnicería más grande donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes. Este será el décimo quinto crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para que pueda cumplir sus sueños. Además desea cumplir con el pagos de sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida y solidaria. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más carne para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en: Julia, 40 years old, is a very friendly and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house alongside her husband, Homero, 47, and their three dear children to whom they wish to provide a better quality of life. Julia's daily activity is selling meat. She has a stall in the No 2 market (an important market in the city of Pucallpa), which is very busy, since she always sells meat of very good quality. She is a very happy seller and receives her customers with a smile on her lips. What she likes most about her work is to converse with her neighboring sellers.  She has been doing this work for 13 years and considers having to stay at her stall all day without being able to leave the most difficult part. However, it's part of the work and of the sacrifice to be able to earn more money. In the future, she wishes to have a larger meat shop where she can attend to her customers better. This will be the fifteenth loan with MFP, so she hopes for the support of all of you so that she can achieve her dreams. In addition, she wishes to make her payments on time. In her community bank, she is a trustworthy and united member. With the 2,000 new "soles" requested, she will buy more meat to stock her stall better.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to stock her business.

loans.name: Duo Mujeres Bellas De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Duo Mujeres Bellas de Vista Hrmosa: Este grupo lo integran dos señoras las cuales estam nuy contentas porque tienen la oportunidad de un credito ya que doña Vilma se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos en general y nos cuenta que nececita mas capital para trabajar por eso solicita este credito para la compra de cosmeticos,doña Rosa tiene una tienda de productos comestibles de primera nececidad ella tambien nececita el credito para la compra de productos comestibles ya que sus clientes le hacen pedidos y nececita mas capital para trabajar
texts.en:
'Mujeres Bellas de Vista Hermosa' group

This two ladies who make up this group are very happy that they have the opportunity to receive this loan.  Vilma sells cosmetics.  She tells us that she needs more capital in order to work.  She is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics.  Rosa owns a grocery store.  She also needs a loan to buy food products as her customers make orders with her and she needs more capital in order to work.

loans.use: to buy food products and cosmetics

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 43 years old. She is a hard working businesswoman. She is single and blessed with two children aged 20 and 18. To cater to her family's needs, she has been running a general shop for the last one and a half years. In the next five years, she wants to have a wholesale business. She wants a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy rice, sugar, maize flour, sweets and biscuits.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, maize flour, sweets and biscuits

loans.name: Riqchary Huarmimasicuna Group

texts.es:
Todo empezó una noche en el cual me comunicaron con el analista de crédito Ferdinan para realizar un viaje donde  visitaríamos al banco comunal “Riqchary Huarmimasicuna” y nuestro destino era el poblado de KITENI, distrito de Echarate provincia de La Convención del departamento del Cusco, Perú. El poblado de Kiteni está ubicado a  8 horas de la ciudad de Quillabamba. 

El banco comunal “Riqchary Huarmimasicuna” tiene 5 años de funcionamiento y está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría de los pobladores se dedican a actividades de comercio, ganadería y agricultura. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en el poblado de Kiteni y donde conocimos al socia Ruth Mery. 

Ruth Mery nos cuenta: “Nací en la ciudad de Kiteni, tengo 23 años edad y todavía no tengo hijos pero muy pronto seré mamá y vivo en la ciudad donde nací y donde mi actividad principal es la venta de comida”.
Ruth Mery tiene un pequeño restaurante donde sirve desayuno, almuerzo y cena pero por el momento el negocio está paralizado porque el local lo estan refaccionando. Ya es un año que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ruth Mery por el momento está trabajando en una lavandería lavando ropa desde las 7 de la mañana hasta el medio día de lunes a viernes. Su padre le invito a participar en el banco comunal y su primer crédito fue de S/. 800 nuevos soles y lo utilizó para comprar insumos. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para implementar su restaurante y desea comprar sillas, mesas y utensilios.
texts.en:
It all started one night when I spoke with a loan analyst, Ferdinan, in order for us to visit the Riqchary Huarmimasicuna Communal Bank.  Our destination was the town of Kiteni, Echarate district, La Convención province, Cusco department in Perú.  The town of Kiteni is eight hours from the city of Quillabama.

The Riqchary Huarmimasicuna Communal Bank has been operational for five years.  It is comprised of hard-working and enterprising people who, at every moment, are seeking opportunities to get ahead.  Through their daily efforts they are looking to give their children a better future.  The majority of the inhabitants devote themselves to commerce, livestock, and farming.  The communal bank meets once a month in the town of Kiteni.  This is where we met a member, Ruth Mery.

Ruth Mery tell us, “I was born in the city of Kiteni.  I am 23 years old.  I do not yet have children, but I will soon be a mother.  I live in the city where I was born and where my primary business activity is selling food.”  Ruth Mery has a small restaurant where she sells breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  At the moment the business is incapacitated because they are refurbishing the place.

She has been in the business for one year, and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  At this time Ruth Mery is working in a laundry washing clothes from seven in the morning until midday on Mondays through Fridays.

Her father invited her to participate in the communal bank.  Her first loan was for 800 soles, and she used it to buy supplies.  This time she needs the loan to equip her restaurant, and she wants to buy chairs, tables, and utensils.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur  Ruth Mery from  Peru

loans.use: to equip her restaurant and buy chairs, tables, and utensils.

loans.name: Cyprien

texts.en:
Cyprien has been a Rwandan rice farmer for the past two years and was trained by his COOP (cooperative).

He will use his Kiva loan to cover labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding against birds, and then in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To cover labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela: de 49 año de edad ella se dedica al cultivo de maiz,frijol,rabanos,etc desde hace varios años.a parte de eso ella se dedica a la crianza de animales como pollos entre otros,ella se siente muy contenta porque cre que fape le pueda ayudar con el credito solicitado ya que utilizara el credito para la compra de semillas,y abono para el cultivo,el sueño de ella es darles estudios a sus hijos y que salgan adelante.
texts.en: Adela: de 49 año de edad ella se dedica al cultivo de maiz,frijol,rabanos,etc desde hace varios años.a parte de eso ella se dedica a la crianza de animales como pollos entre otros,ella se siente muy contenta porque cre que fape le pueda ayudar con el credito solicitado ya que utilizara el credito para la compra de semillas,y abono para el cultivo,el sueño de ella es darles estudios a sus hijos y que salgan adelante.

loans.use: Compra de semillas y abono para el cultivo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for his workshop: solid iron and angled iron.

loans.name: Bertha De Jesus

texts.es:
Bertha de 66 años,  es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un pequeño negocio en la parte delantera de su casa. Comenzó hace 20 años atrás como enfermera pero debido a que se jubilo decidió tener su propia papelería.  En la actualidad trabaja junto a su hija en su papelería desde muy temprano. 

En la actualidad ella vende en la papelería hojas, plumas, artículos, cuadernos y todo tipo de suministros para la etapa escolar.  Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso lo quiere agrandarlo para ubicar mas papelería. Comprando con el prestamo cemento, arena y bloques. Sus pensamientos en un futuro son construir mejor su negocio y casa para darle una mejor vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Bertha is 66 years old. This hardworking woman has a small business in the front part of her house. She began working as a nurse 20 years ago, but when she retired she decided to start her own stationery store. Bertha and her daughter currently work together and open their stationery store very early.

She sells stationery sheets, pens, paper, notebooks, and all types of supplies for the school year. Bertha has many aspirations for her business, which is why she wants to expand her stationery store. She will buy cement, sand, and blocks. Her plans for the future are to continue improving her business and her home so that she can provide a better life for her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials so that she can expand her stationery store.

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya is a widow. Her husband died suddenly a few years ago. It was a very difficult time for Surriya but she never lost heart and worked very hard to raise her children. She is the mother of 3 sons, all of who left their education after 5th grade and started work to contribute financially to the family. 

She performed her duties as a seamstress and started getting orders from her neighbors. She made her neighbors become regular customers due to the good-quality work she produces. Now she receives regular orders every month which enables her to generate income for her family. 

She also has a buffalo whose milk she sells to her neighborhood clients and milk shops to earn extra profits. Surriya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her milk-selling business. With the loan, she will buy another buffalo that will allow her to get larger quantities of milk and increase her profits. She is hopeful that this investment will be more profitable for her.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk-selling business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica de 30 años de edad convive hace 3 años con su esposo, con quien tiene 4 hijos pequeños. Ellos viven en armonía en una casa rústica de su propiedad. Su principal actividad es la agricultura. En sus 2 parcelas de terreno siembran café, para negociar; y yuca para el consumo de su familia. A parte de eso, Verónica cuenta con un pequeño negocio en su casa, ahí vende golosinas, gaseosas y cervezas. Por su parte, de vez en cuando, su esposo trabaja en el campo de personas ajenas. Próximamente piensa ampliar su negocio de gaseosas y cervezas, pues sabe que es rentable y trae buenos ingresos, para ello necesitará acondicionar un nuevo ambiente. El tema económico y la falta de presupuesto fueron sus principales inconvenientes, tanto en la siembra como el negocio, situación que piensan superar con esfuerzo. “Mas adelante me gustaría tener una casa bonita, confío mucho en Dios y sé que si me esmero lo podré lograr”, cuenta entusiasta. Trabaja por primera vez con MFP y su banco comunal, del cual se siente cómoda y agradecida. Invertirá el préstamo en la compra de una refrigeradora, por exigencia de su pequeño mercado; también más gaseosas y cervezas.
texts.en:
Verónica is 30 years old. She has lived with her husband for three years and they have four small children. They live harmoniously in a rustic house they own. Their main business is agriculture. In their two plots of land they sow coffee for selling and manioc for their family's consumption.
Besides that, Verónica runs a small business from her home, where she sells candy, soft drinks and beer. On his part, her husband works in other people's lands from time to time.
She plans to soon expand her soft drinks and beer business, because she knows it is profitable and generates a nice income. For that she will need to set up a new room. Financial matters and the lack of a budget have been their main obstacles both in farming and in this business, a situation they hope to overcome with their efforts.
"In time I would like to own a beautiful house. I trust in God a great deal and I know that if I work hard I can achieve that", she says enthusiastically. This is the first time she works with MFP and the communal bank, in which she feels comfortable and grateful. She will use the loan to purchase a refrigerator, which her small store demands, and also more soft drinks and beer.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and more beverages.

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en: Munhbat is 27 years old and lives with his parents and brother in a ger (a mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor, Mongolia. His father is a taxi driver, his mother runs a coal retail business and his brother is a college student. Munhbat started his cell phone repair and retail business in 2009 and his business has been sustainable ever since. He is known as the 'gold-handed kid' in the neighborhood, a nickname he was given for being an excellent repairman. Munhbat has a bright vision to open another branch of his workshop. He is an excellent, skilled and hardworking man, but as he says, "Now that cell phone's are more advanced, my tools and kits are too old to repair". Munhbat is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy some tools and cell phone parts.

loans.use: to buy some tools and cell phone parts.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has four children between the ages of 11 and 2.  Three of them go to school. 

Jane runs a fish store and has been in the business for five years. She has no employees. Jane heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients. She is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase more dried fish. Jane has no other source of income. 

In five years time, Jane would like to increase the size of her business.  

Her major challenges include high competition in the market, her low-income and her home expenses.   

Jane says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support in South Sudan for empowering women in terms of giving loans.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish.

loans.name: 05.01.41 Điện Biên Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hòa operates a food stall selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables to sell. She is 54 years old and married with three children. Hòa is the leader of a 5-member group, the 05.01.41 Điện Biên solidarity group. She lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. All of her children got jobs, 2 sons is carpenter and 1 daughter has a vegetable stall in market.

In 2010, Hòa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hòa has been involved in here business for 6 years, her main hardship being the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hòa hopes her childrenwill find good jobs, to be able to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable to sell.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: B., a 41-year-old man, lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda with 3 children. He deals in a poultry product business where he keeps layers, broilers and young chicks. He has challenges in his business such as high prices for chicken feed, limited capital for expansion, theft and some customers don't usually pay on time. His business goal is to operate a large scale production and his personal goal is educating his children B. wants money to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is requesting a loan from KIVA's partner Asasah for her brother’s animal sales business. He will use the loan to buy goats and sheep in larger numbers. He will raise them and sell them to butchers for a profit. Khursheed's brother has been operating his business for many years and Khursheed is confident that an investment will enable him to be more productive and to increase his income.

Khursheed is a housewife, staying at home and managing her household responsibilities. Her husband has a job. Khursheed is the mother of 2 children, both very young and not yet of school going age. Khursheed is a very responsible person and is always willing to help her family in difficult times. She is hopeful that her brother will make good use of this loan and increase his income by expanding his business. Note: In the photo, Khursheed is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 56 years old and married with 4 children.

Luzviminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Luzviminda has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Luzviminda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 29-year-old married woman with two children. One of her children is in school. She has had a business selling clothes in Yambio, South Sudan for four years.

Martha is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Felisters

texts.en:
Felisters is 31 years old and married to Edward. They have 4 children. She has operated a hotel (the local term for "restaurant") for the last 3 years in Kimilili town in western Kenya. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 50,000, which she will use to buy a freezer for the hotel. She intends to use her profits to expand the hotel to serve to more clients.

Her dream is to open other branches to increase her turnover and to be able to feed and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer for her hotel (restaurant).

loans.name: Jodhan

texts.en:
Jodhan is very thankfull to all his kiva lenders for helping him with his rice production.

With the profits of last season Jodhan could save for the education of his children and also for a piece of land for his livestock. But that is enough for buying that. So he has to save more. 

For that he has expand his rice productions and asks Kiva lenders another loan of SRD 13000 for the purchase of diesel, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase diesel, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.ru:
Аъзамчон жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 30 лет. Он женат и имеет 2-их детей. Он обратился в МДО Арванд когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку для развития своего бизнеса.  Сам Аъзамчон живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего  образования, так как не учился Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Аъзамчона также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.
Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Аъзамчон занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Также Аъзамчон подрабатывает строителем, собирает доски для продажи.  От данного дела он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Аъзамчону в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота.  Сейчас Аъзамчон хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку корма для животноводства . Аъзамчон очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Azam is a cheerful and hard-working man of 30 years. He is married and has two children. He approached MDO Arvand when he found out that he could receive financial support to expand his business. Azam lives with his family in a rural area. He does not have a secondary education, because he couldn't study at university due to his family's financial difficulties. Azam's wife also doesn't have an education and works as a housewife, taking care of the housework and raising their children.

In order to have a means of sustenance, Azam runs his own business. He fattens and sells cattle. Azam also works on the side as a builder, and he gathers lumber to sell. He makes a good living from these occupations. Azam's wife also helps him with his business, selling milk that they get from the livestock. Now Azam wants to increase his number of livestock and expand his business. With this in mind, he has approached MDO Arvand and wants to receive a loan to buy feed for raising cattle. Azam is very hopeful for a positive outcome and thanks MDO Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, She also earns additional income from service (massage ). Lourdes is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save capital to have additional business.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor sells clothes and accessories. He stared the business with the help of a brother who provided some merchandise for him to get off the ground. At first he only sold cloths and plastics door-to-door and now he has opened a store where he sells all types of clothing and accessories. Victor is planning to break into the household appliances market with this loan. He will use the capital to invest in microwaves and small kitchen appliances that are very popular in the sector. He believes that there is high demand for these products in his area and that his investment will be successful. Victor is very confident that things will go well and he will be able to provide a better future for his three kids.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: He will use the capital to invest in microwaves and small kitchen appliances that are very popular in the sector.

loans.name: Adwah

texts.en: Mama Adu sells Agri produce such as beans, rice, and groundnuts in tins, and crates of eggs. She is in need of a loan and therefore seeking $725.00 from Kiva to enable her expand.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Protected

texts.en:
Miss Madleen Hamo is a single mother with three female children working hard to earn money for her family. She apped for a loan from Al-Aman to develop her hair salon. Her daughters work with her in the same shop. She wants to purchase new equipment for her salon and she wants to earn more money to enhance her family's living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new equipment for her salon

loans.name: Teyyar

texts.en: Teyyar Q. is a 51-year-old married man who has two grown up children. Teyyar runs a petrol station in a southern Azerbaijani town, Imishli. He opened his petrol station in 1998. Teyyar works from wee hours in the morning until late at night, because he has a lot of clients (more than 60 people an hour). Teyyar does not want to lose his clientele to delays and therefore would like to purchase an additional petrol station.  He is therefore requesting a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: To purchase another petrol station

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 34 years old and has four children. She has a restaurant that she has operated for the past eight years. The restaurant consists of two outdoor cooking pots heated with charcoal. She has a small wood frame hut with a corrugated roof for her clients to sit under. Her customers include school children and passer-bys.

Her first loan was for $30.00 USD, using the funds to buy cooking oil, wheat flour and milk daily. With this new loan, she plans to add to her menu tea, chapatas, and meals with sauces. She has been receiving loans for several years and she is always able to make her payments.

loans.use: To buy more tea, chapatas and sauces for her restaurant

loans.name: Haja Sundu

texts.en: Haja is 47 years old and a widow with 5 children and 3 adopted children.  She does farming and has a small business.  Because of her creativity and hard work, she was made a leader of the women farmers association in the village of Koinadugu in Sierra Leone.  Seeing the problems faced by women subsistence farmers in obtaining seeds and other farm implements, Haja started a small agro-business shop where she took some seeds and fertilizers on loan to be sold to the farmers. She also supplies seeds to some NGOs, but at a small scale.  With cash loans from SMT, she was able to expand her stock, but still more needs to be done. Haja is now discussing with SMT how women subsistence farmers can get access to loans so that they can expand their farm land and produce more food for sale and for consumption.  Haja is therefore requesting $1200 mainly for purchasing more seeds for Irish potatoes, carrots, rice, and peanuts.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds to supply local women subsistence farmers.

loans.name: Phov

texts.en: Mrs. Phov S., 38, runs a stand at home selling a variety of grocery products to the people in her community and generally makes about $3/day in revenue. Her husband works driving a motor-taxi, making up to $5 per day. Mostly his passenger base is in front of a market. Mrs. Phov Savannarith has three children who are students. She has requested for a loan to purchase a new motorcycle for her husband because his current motor-bike is frequently broken and costs her family a lot of money to repair. (Her husband is pictured with a motor-bike he plans to buy to run a business).

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle for her husband to operate a business

loans.name: Allahverdi

texts.en: Allahverdi is a 58-year-old Internally Displaced Person from the Khojavand region situated in the east part of the country, in the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict zone. He lives in the Lokbatan settlement in the suburbs of Baku with his family--his wife and three children. He breeds cattle in the shed that he built. He has been engaged in this business for three years. He buys cattle, raises them and sells them alive to the local market or to butchers. Cattle breeding has become traditional and it can bring good income. Allahverdi wants to develop this business, to increase the number of cows. He wants to buy more calves to add to his livestock.

loans.use: To increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa is a single mother, caring for a son still in elementary school. She lives in Ticuantepe and for 10 years the business she operates has supported her. Rosa's economic situation has been difficult but her store has allowed her to get the things she needs and, with financing, she's been able to improve parts of her house as well as invest in her business. The business needs to expand and offer a wider range of merchandise to the people of the Ticuantepe neighborhood. By expanding the business and offering new products, her customer's might reach deeper into their pockets to buy the things that the customers she targets need.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa Maria es madre soltera, cuida de su hijo quien se encuentra estudiando en primaria, habita en ticuantepe y hace 10 años tiene su negocio, el cual le ha permitido subsanar todos los gastos del hogar. La situación económica de doña Rosa ha sido difícil, pero su pulpería le ha permitido hacer frente a las necesidades que posee, con financiamiento ha podido mejorar ciertas partes de su vivienda así como también invertir en el negocio, el cual requiere de ampliación y de diversificación de las líneas de productos que ofrece a los pobladores de las comunidades de Ticuantepe. Esperar llegar a expandir su negocio ofreciendo una gama de productos nuevos a sus clientes que estén al alcance de sus bolsillos y satisfagan las necesidades básicas de alimentación de los clientes a quienes se dirige.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.fr:
Born on January 25, 1985 in Lomé, Miss Latifa L. is unmarried. She owns a hairdressing salon called “Benediction” in Tokoin Novissi. Here she also sells hair extensions and cosmetics. She started the business in 2007 with a small clientele. In view of the large number of customers she has today, she wishes to buy a hair dryer, two boxes of hair extensions and some cosmetics. She is therefore requesting a loan of FCFA 300,000. 
Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer. 
Née le 25 janvier 1985 à Lomé, Mademoiselle L. Latifa est célibataire. Elle est propriétaire du salon de coiffure dénommé « BENEDICTION » sis à Tokoin Novissi. Dans son salon, elle vend également des mèches et des produits cosmétiques. Elle a démarré cette activité en 2007 avec une clientèle restreinte. Actuellement vu l’importance de sa clientèle elle désire acheter un séchoir, deux cartons de mèches et quelques produits cosmétiques. Elle  sollicite alors un emprunt d’un montant de 300.000FCFA

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and cosmetics

loans.name: De L'union Group

texts.en:
Estime is a strong-willed and determined woman who lives in Trou du Nord, Haiti with her 5 children (ages: 13, 15, 17, 19, 21). She currently works as a seamstress, but wants to use this loan to change her business into a place where she can sell clothes as well.

With this loan, she will buy fabric to make clothing that she can sell, and she may also buy some used clothing for her business. Her goals for the future are to open a small classroom for children in her community, and to see her business grow.

We are excited that you can join us in watching Estime and the rest of her group excel over the next 6 months. God Bless!

loans.use: To purchase fabric and used clothes.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Q., 50 years old, joined TYM Fund in 2003. She has a husband and two children. Her first loan of 70USD was used to brew wine. After the first year, her profit was 100USD. In those next three years, she continued to take loans to brew wine and breeding pigs. Last year, she was able to rebuild her house. Now the price of materials for construction work is increasing, so Mrs. Q. discussed with her husband to borrow 950USD to buy some land and produce bricks. This new job will bring more profit, yet it requires a lot of investment. Mrs. Q. hopes that she will be able to borrow bigger loan in the next years. Her family's average monthly income is 250USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Quỳ, 50 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2003. Gia đình chị gồm hai vợ chồng và 2 người con. Số vốn vay 70USD lần đầu được chị Quỳ đầu tư cho việc mua gạo nấu rượu. Cuối vòng vốn chị lãi được 100USD. Trong 3 năm tiếp theo chị Quỳ tiếp tục vay vốn về nấu rượu và chăn nuôi lợn. Đến năm ngoái chị đã xây được một căn nhà mới. Hiện nay giá nguyên vật liệu xây dựng đang lên, chị Quỳ bàn với chồng vay 950USD về mua đất về sản xuất gạch xây dựng. Nghề này mang lại nhiều lợi nhuận nhưng cũng đòi hỏi phải có vốn lớn. Chị Quỳ mong các năm tiếp theo chị sẽ được vay mức vốn lớn hơn. Thu nhập hiện nay của gia đình là 250USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy clay to make bricks

loans.name: Struggle Group

texts.en: Aminata J. is a SMT client who has accessed several small loans.  The group leader and mother of 6 children sells children's shoes and Gara, tye-dye materials.  She has been running the business for six years and her income plays a major role in meeting her children's educational expenses.  She is very happy to join Kiva and would like to access a larger loan to expand her business.  Fatmata and Kadijatu own grocery stalls in Makeni market.  The group is requesting a loan of Le.2,400,000 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To increase stocks of shoes, tye-dye materials, and groceries

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila has rented out rooms and apartments for 15 years. She used to live with her mother, but met her current partner and decided to buy a house. She began renting her garage, and then she built rooms and two apartments in her home in order to rent them out. Currently, Lucila keeps constructing rooms.

Lucila has worked selling clothes to order for 9 years, as well. She keeps working in this business and sells clothing to her neighbors.

The loan that she is requesting will help her buy accessories and furnishings for the bathroom in one of her rental rooms. She would like to continue building more apartments in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Lucila se dedica al alquiler de cuartos y departamentos desde hace 15 años. Ella antes vivía con su mamá, pero conoció a su actual pareja y decidió comprarse una casa. Ella empezó alquilando su cochera, luego construyó cuartos y dos departamentos en su casa para alquilarlos. En la actualidad, Lucila sigue construyendo cuartos.

Pero, Lucila se dedica a la venta de ropa por pedidos desde que tiene 9 años. Ella sigue en este negocio y ofrece ropa a sus vecinos.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le servirá para los accesorios y arreglos del baño de uno de los cuartos que alquila. A ella le gustaría seguir construyendo más departamentos en su casa.

loans.use: Purchase accessories and furnishings for the bathrooms in one of her rental rooms

loans.name: Dalanda

texts.fr: Mme Dalanda D. est une vendeuse de legumes tres dynamique . Elle est entreprenante mais ne dispose pas de assez de fonds pour augmenter son volume d'activite dans un secteur tres porteur. Elle sollicite ce credit pour renforcer son stock.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dalanda D. is an dynamic saleswoman of vegetable products. She is enterprising, but does not have the available funds to increase her sales volume in this very flourishing market. She is requesting this loan to increase her stock.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Mukadam

texts.en:
Mukadam T. is 44 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three children. She lives in Khujand town and owns a small store in the local market. Mukadam has been selling children’s clothing for about 10 years. Her store is well known in the market for having a nice variety of assorted children’s clothing at affordable prices.

Mukadam's profit from the business has increased extensively since she started her business. Mukadam has a unique ability to analyze a merchandise market and find her niche. This is something that helped her start her business and make it successful. Today she is requesting a loan of 800 USD for the term of 12 months to increase the assortment of her inventory and her sales and profit as a result. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: Increasing working capital with the purpose of development of business

loans.name: Hilario De Jesus

texts.es:
El caballero Hilario L. es originario del municipio de Condega y desde hace varios años se dedica a la actividad de ganadería el cual atiende con mucho esfuerzo para mantener su hogar. Es casado y con el deber de mantener su núcleo familiar. Es por este motivo que ha decidido una vez más buscar el apoyo en Ceprodel para la compra de ganado y así dar lugar a la crianza de este.

Son sus sueños desarrollarse más en su actividad y de esta forma realizar más créditos para continuar con el mantenimiento de su humilde hogar de habitación. Actualmente él tiene un total de 4 créditos habiéndolos cancelado todos en tiempo y forma.
texts.en:
The gentleman Hilario L. is originally from the municipality of Condega and for several years has dedicated himself to cattle ranching. He has attended to this work with great effort in order to maintain his home. He is married and has the duty of supporting his family. For this reason he has decided to once again come to Ceprodel for help in buying cattle to raise.

It is his dream to develop his business with more loans and in this way continue to maintain his humble home. At this time he has taken out 4 loans and has repaid them all in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith, ya cumplidos sus 30 años, convive con su pareja que trabaja como chofer de transporte de pasajeros, tienen 3 hijos. Se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y de sus estudios de lunes a viernes, los fines de semana acude a sus campos de cultivo de papa, que siembra para consumo propio, ya que nos cuenta lo que compra con dinero en el mercado no le es suficiente. A ella le gusta la actividad de la agricultura porque desde muy niña ha crecido en ese ambiente, sus padres eran agricultores; para ella la chacra ha sido la fuente principal de ingresos  económicos, los productos que cultiva son indispensables para el menú diario. La dificultad que tiene, es que a su pareja, no le gusta la actividad de la chacra, por ellos lo realiza sola. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita contratará a peones para trabajar en sus tierras, cada uno cobra 15 soles por semana, calcula que serán 20 personas, el resto del dinero lo usará en la compra de herbecidas.
texts.en:
Edith is 30 years old, lives with her partner who works as a chauffer transporting passengers, and they have three children. She dedicates herself to caring for the children and to her studies from Monday to Friday. On the weekends, she tends to her farmland where she cultivates potatoes that she plants for her own consumption since, as she tells us, what she buys at the market is not enough. She likes farming because, since she was a young girl, she was raised in this environment. Her parents were farmers and, for her, this activity has been the primary source of income. The items she grows are indispensable to the daily menu. The difficulty she has is that her partner does not enjoy farming, so she undertakes her activities on her own. This is her 7th loan with MFP. With the funds she is requesting, she will hire laborers to help work her land. Each worker charges 15 soles per week, and she calculates she would need 20 people. The remainder of the funds would be used to purchase herbicides.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire laborers to help her work her farmland.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora María Teresa tiene 61 años D. edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Bellavista II y vive en la calle Los Ángeles 799, distrito La Esperanza, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió 3 años D. Enfermería Técnica, lo que en su tiempo se llamaba Auxiliar D. Enfermería, pero no tuvo oportunidad D. trabajar en su profesión. Tiene una hija D. 42 años, que siempre la alegra con sus visitas y las D. sus nietos.
María tiene una bodega donD. venD. artículos D. primera necesidad y donD. venD. tejidos y bordados en cinta que ella misma confecciona. El negocio lo realiza en su casa y también D. manera ambulante, porque ofrece sus tejidos en las calles.
Con el primer crédito D. S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas, compró hilos para los tejidos.
Con este crédito D. S/, 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en insumos para la bodega.
María sueña con tener una tienda D. artesanía en el centro D. la ciudad.
texts.en:
Doña María Teresa is 61 years old, she belongs to "Banco Comunal Bellavista II" and lives in Los Angeles No. 799, district La Esperanza, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She studied technical nursing, then it was called assistant nursing, but never had a chance to work. She has a 42 year-old daughter who always brightens up her day visiting her with her grandchildren.

María has a general store where she sells groceries as well as fabrics, knitted and embroidered by herself. The business is located at her house and she also offers her fabrics in the streets. With the first loan of S/.300, repaid in 4 payments, she bought knitting yarn. With this credit of S/.500, to be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy products for her general store. It is María's dream to have a crafts store in the center of the town.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for general store.

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Rokhaya N., 58 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Bayakh 1 depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter du bissap, du sucre, arome et autres  pour faire des crèmes glacées, du jus et renforcer sa boutique.  Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Rokhaya N., age 58, is married and has been a member of the village association of Bayakh 1 for seven and a half years. She wants to buy bissap (dried hibiscus flowers), sugar, flavoring, and more to make ice cream and juices, so that she can provide a boost to her shop. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bissap, sugar, and other ingredients for making juices and ice cream

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
ROXANA D. A. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Líderes” ubicado en la Av. Miraflores Mz. 1, Lt. 11 D. distrito de callería, tiene 2 años de edad, 02 hijos menores de edad, ella vende pescado seco en la Av. Maya de Britto (1 cuadra) en el mercado Bellavista.

Su primero préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles que recibió, compró pescado fresco en diversas variedades y en poca cantidad.

Su esposo se levantaba muy temprano para la compra D. pescado, llevaba al mercado donde la señora Roxana lo esperaba para la venta.

Roxana con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprara pescado seco de primera calidad, pescado fresco como. Gamitana, doncella, paco, palometa, etc., gracias a la gran clientela que adquirió.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por el gran apoyo hacia su persona, el progreso de su familia se siente realizada.
texts.en:
Roxana D. A. Rodríguez belongs to the community bank “Mujeres Lideres” (Women Leaders) located at Ave. Miraflores Mz 1, Lot 11 of the District of Calleria. She is 22 years old and has 2 young children. She sells dried fish at Ave. Maya de Britto (1st block) in the Bellavista market. Her first loan was for 300.00 Nuevo Soles and with that she bought a variety of fresh fish in small quantities. Her husband gets up very early to go buy the fish and he brings it to the market where Miss Roxana waits to sell it. Roxana is asking for 1,000.000 Nuevo Soles, which she will use to buy high quality dried fish and fresh fish like Pacu, Damselfish, Paco and Palometa. She is thankful for the many clients she has served. She is grateful for Manuela Ramos for the support they have given her and the progress she has made with her family. She feels complete.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dried fish and fresh fish

loans.name: Ayao André

texts.fr: Monsieur A. Ayao andré est un menusier, il habite le quartier d’adidogomé, il est spécialisé dans la fabrication des meubles qu’il revend après, il dispose d’un atelier qu’il a appelé menuserie ELOLO. Il n’a jamais obtenu de prêt de wages et sollicite son premier c r édit d’un montant de 300000F pour acheter des planches. Il fait ce commerce depuis 1988. Il est un homme marié avec deux enfants à sa charge.
texts.en:
Mr. Ayao André A. is a cabinet maker and lives in the Adidogomé district. He specializes in making furniture, which he then sells. He has a workshop that he calls “Menuserie ELOLO”. He has never been the recipient of a WAGES loan and is requesting his first loan in the amount of 30,000 francs CFA for buying planks. Mr. A. has been in this business since 1988. He is a married man with two children to support.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber

loans.name: Wcsl Mabanta/makama Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the WCSL Mabanta/Makama Primary Schools. These schools, WCSL Mabanta and WCSL Makama, were established by the Wesleyan Church of Sierra Leone. Since both schools from the villages of Mabanta and Makama operate on the same payroll, they have merged to seek a loan from Kiva through SMT.

This will be the second loan WCSL Mabanta will be receiving from Kiva through SMT. The previous loan that WCSL Mabanta received from Kiva through SMT created a tremendous impact in the lives of these teachers. Because of the successes of the first loan to the teachers of WCSL Mabanta, WCSL Makama from the next village has decided to join their colleagues in seeking a loan from SMT.

WCSL Mabanta was established in 1970 to give formal training to the children of Mabanta village and its environs. Over the years, this school has produced a great number of lecturers, teachers, and many other professionals in different walks of life. Presently, the school has 368 pupils with a staff of 10 teachers.

With this loan, some of these teachers will start a small business and those who are already running small businesses will invest the loan into their business. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children in their education or pay for themselves to pursue further studies. Others will use their loan in home-building projects.

Fifty-three year old Solomon S. K. (right) is the headmaster at the school. He was born in a village called Rogbin. He is married with three children – two of whom are in Junior Secondary Schools I (JSS I) and the eldest is in a Teachers Training College pursuing a Higher Teachers’ Certificate. Solomon will use his loan to buy house-building materials like corrugated iron zinc, boards, stick and nails. Solomon’s greatest desire is to see the completion of the house he is constructing. Being able to complete building his house will relieve him of the many problems tenants suffer at the hands of landlords, he told me.

loans.use: Buy house-building materials like corrugated iron zinc, boards, stick and nails

loans.name: Liliana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Liliana Elizabeth M. Q. tiene 27 años, vive en la Urb. El Cortijo del distrito de Trujillo,  provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella es Abogada de profesión y trabaja en la Fiscalia de la Esperanza, no tiene hijos.
Liliana se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace 6 años cuando estaba aun estudiando, se inició ayudando a su hermana a  vender hasta que se hizo de clientes y empezó a vender por si sola, dejó la venta por un tiempo debido a que viajó, luego retomó su negocio y con las ganancias que ha obtenido a decidido iniciarse en la siembra de papa en sociedad con su novio. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Nuevo Perú”, lo invirtió en aumentar su capital comprando productos de belleza para su stock.
Con el crédito de 1000 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de medicinas y abonos para la siembra de papa.
Liliana sueña con tener su casa propia, comprarse un carro y culminar sus estudios profesionales.
texts.en:
Liliana Elizabeth M. Q. is 27 years old and lives in Urb. El Cortijo in the Trujillo district and province, in La Libertad, Peru. She is a lawyer by profession and works in Fiscalia de la Esperanza (Hope Prosecutor's Office). She does not have any children. Liliana has been dedicated to selling beauty products for six years which she started when she was still studying. She started helping her sister with sales until she found her own customers and began to sell on her own. She left sales for a time on account of a trip. Then she picked up her business again and, with the earnings that she has obtained, she has decided to start planting potatoes in partnership with her boyfriend. She is developing her business in her home. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from her community bank, Nuevo Peru (New Peru), she invested in increasing her capital buying beauty products for her stock. With the loan of 1,000 soles, which will be repaid in four months, she will invest in the purchase of medicines and fertilizers for potato planting. Liliana dreams of having her own home, buying a car and finishing her professional studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase medicines and fertilizers for planting.

loans.name: Sekinat

texts.en: Sekinat is 36 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is a tailor and also sells sarongs. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Paola Sobeidy

texts.es:
Paola, vive en la Avenida Buenos Aires de la zona Villa Yunguyo en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive  en la casa de sus padres, Ella es madre soltera tiene una pequeña hija de 2 años de edad.
 
Se dedica al comercio mediante una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que posee en el lugar donde vive. 


El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería, y así mejorar sus ingresos

Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Paola lives on Buenos Aires Avenue in the Villa Yunguyo zone in the city of El Alto. She is a single mother with a 2 -year-old daughter and lives in her parents' home. Paola owns and operates a small grocery store in her neighborhood. This loan will be used to purchase additional merchandise so she can increase her income. This is her first loan with Impro. Impro conducted an evaluation of her business and approved her request for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is twenty-three years old. She is single and lives alone in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Grace is a petty trader. She sells textiles – printed and designed fabrics. She hawks her fabrics and also treks to other towns to sell. Grace procures her materials from Dormaa, the district capital. She has been in business for one year now and wants a loan to procure textiles in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and have some savings for her future.

loans.use: To procure textiles

loans.name: Kuña Guapa 2 Group

texts.en:
This group has been with the Fundación for two years and comes from the neighborhood of San Lucas, just outsiD. of Ciudad del Este.  The group is maD. up of 19 women, all friends and neighbors.  3,500,000 Gs is their savings.  There is much support and responsibility amongst this group of women.  They are also very interested in learning more about finances so that they can better run their businesses.  

1	Felipa D. M. N.	Dressmaker 
2	Celia G.	Small grocery store 
3	Filomena L.	Small grocery store 
4	Florentina R.	Small grocery store 
5	Francisaca V.	Pastry/sweets sales 
6	Ester R.	Dressmaker 
7	Josefina A.	Jewelry sales 
8	Rafaela V. 	Undergarment sales 
9	Valeria T.	Clothing sales 
10	Angelina R.	Candy sales 
11	Carmen Q.	Dressmaker 
12	Maristela B.	Furniture sales 
13	Sunilda M.	Cleaning product sales 
14	Adelaida S.	Diner 
15	Aparicia G.	Electronics sales 
16	Teresa O.	Clothing sales 
17	Maria R.	Food sales 
18	Leonora G.	Dressmaker 
19	Fidelina G.	Clothing sales

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as fabrics, foodstuffs, electronics, clothes, jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Rincon Portada Group

texts.es:
En la conocida feria 16 de julio ubicada en la zona del mismo nombre (ciudad de El Alto) ofrecen sus productos las integrantes de la asociación “Rincón Portada” pertenece al centro focal Alto Lima, está formado por once miembros que lograron consolidarse en este grupo hace cinco años aproximadamente.
Se dedican a la venta de verduras, queso, medias, carne de pollo, ropa tejida a mano, también realizan tejidos artesanales, elaboran pipocas (palomitas de maíz) y también confeccionan colchones.
Ahora la asociación Rincón Portada necesita comprar mercadería y materia prima  para aumentar su producción y posteriores ventas, tienen la seguridad que obtendrán mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The members of the Rincón Portada association sell their products in the well known 16 de julio fair, which is located in the zone of the same name (city of El Alto). They belong to the Alto Lima community center. The group formed approximately five years ago with 11 members. They sell vegetables, cheese, socks, chicken, and hand woven clothes. They also make handicrafts, popcorn, and mattresses. The Rincón Portada association now needs to buy merchandise and raw materials to increase their production and sales. They are sure that they will obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and raw material

loans.name: Nyame Behwe Yen Group

texts.en:
Margaret is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to one daughter. She runs a cold store. Margaret is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame behwe yen ’. This means 'God will cater for us'. She is seated in front in the group photograph.

Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and/or farmers. They work to help their spouses provide for their families. They buy their raw materials or goods from other towns and sometimes from nearby communities and sell them at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well.

The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are therefore asking for the loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses. It is the heartfelt desire of the group members to give their children the best of education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame  Fatoumata  Traoré  est âgée de 29  ans, mariée et  mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants au  quartier Sido Soninkoura de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle abandonna l’école en classe de 5ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour aider sa mère qui vendait des condiments alimentaires. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage auprès de cette dernière, elle jouit d’une très grande expérience dans le commerce d’articles divers, notamment. la vente du bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois qu’elle mène depuis 4 ans. Étant la seule vendeuse du bois de chauffe dans son quartier, elle est très sollicitée.
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle qui augmente de jour en jour elle a décidé de  faire  recours à Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 30 mois. Après 3 prêts solidaires et 1 prêt individuel  tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son 2ème   prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 6 chargements de camion en bois de chauffe. Elle s’approvisionne dans le village  de  Kélékou  auprès des paysans ayant une autorisation  de coupe délivrée par les autorités compétentes.
Madame  Fatoumata  Traoré  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes, parmi ses clients figurent  également quelques hommes qui sont des rôtisseurs.
Ainsi avec ce prêt elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA, ce qui lui permettra de rembourser ses dettes, aider son mari à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et de subvenir à ses propres besoins sans l’aide d’une tierce personne.
Son ambition est de travailler d’avantage afin d’avoir beaucoup et de préparer l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata Traoré is 29 years old, married, and the mother of three.  She lives with her husband and children in the Sido Soninkoura district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She dropped out of her 5th year of primary schooling (education system in Mali) in order to help her mother, who used to sell condiments.  After several years of apprenticeship with her, Fatoumata enjoys a great deal of experience in the commerce of various goods, especially firewood and charcoal, which she has been selling for four years.  Being the only seller of firewood in her district, she is in high demand.  Concerned about satisfying her customers, who grow in number from day to day, she decided to turn toward Soro Yiriwaso 30 months ago.  After three solidarity loans and an individual loan, all correctly repaid, she is now on her second individual loan.  She intends to use it to buy six truck loads of firewood.  She stocks up in the village of Kélékou from rural suppliers possessing a permit to cut, issued by the competent authorities.  Fatoumata sells to customers composed mostly of women, cash or credit accepted.  Among her customers are also a few men, who are roast cooks.  Thus, with this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA, which will enable her to repay her debts, to help her husband cover family expenses, and to provide for herself without any third-party assistance.  Her ambition is to work more in order to have a lot and to make a future for her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
A natural entrepreneur with her finger in many pies.

At 54, Angelica B. is married with 3 adult-age children and lives in Purok Paghidaet, Calumangan, Bago City, Negros Occidental.

Deciding to follow in her parents' footsteps, Angelica and her husband started a piggery business as their main source of income. When she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000, her husband encouraged her to venture in other businesses to supplement their income from the piggery.  With the loans she borrowed from NWTF-Project Dungganon over the last nine years, she has added other businesses like raising chickens and a "sari-sari", or general store, to her roster of business ventures.

Angelica admits that she has learned a lot from her membership in Project Dungganon, which continues to guide her how to improve her management skills and expand her business acumen.
