For this particular loan of PHP 29,500, Angelica plans to purchase fertilizers and other goods to resell to her neighbors and the neighboring farms in her community.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Fertilizers and other goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more goods

loans.name: Camino Seguro Group

texts.es:
CATHERINE B. L., A QUIEN APRECIAMOS EN LA FOTO D. PIÉ, ES UNA JOVEN SOLTERA D. 29 AÑOS, TIENE UN HIJO D. 7 AÑOS Y FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO “CAMINO SEGURO” INTEGRADO POR 10 PERSONAS RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO D. COMAS, CUYA CARACTERÍSITCA PRINCIPAL ES SER TRABAJADORES Y RESPONSABLES.
HACE SIETE AÑOS LA SRA. CATHERINE INICIÓ EN EL NEGOCIO D. LA VENTA D. ABARROTES, EN UN MERCADO LLAMADO “LA FRONTERA”, ELLA TRABAJABA AMBULATORIAMENTE. AL INCIO FUE DURO, NO HABÍA MUCHA CLIENTELA PORQUE EL MERCADO RECIÉN INCIABA SUS ACTIVIDADES, PERO ELLA NUNCA SE RINDIÓ A PESAR D. QUE TUVO DÍAS QUE NO VENDÍA NINGUN PRODUCTO, ELLA PERSISTIÓ Y SIGUIÓ TRABAJANDO CON EL MISMO ENTUSIASMO.
HOY EN DÍA, HA PODIDO ALQIUILAR UN PUESTO EN EL MISMO MERCADO, LE VA BIEN, GRACIAS A SU TRABAJO HA ADQUIRIDO SUS ARTEFACTOS, PUSO A SU HIJO A ESTUDIAR EN UN COLEGIO PARTICULAR Y CON SUS INGRESOS PAGA EL ALQUILER DEL PUESTO EN EL QUE TRABAJA.
ELLA MANIFIESTA QUE SU SUEÑO NO MUY LEJANO A LOGRARSE ES COMPRAR SU CASA, PARA QUE PUEDAN VIVIR CÓMODAMENTE ELLA Y SU HIJO.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO DESTINARÁ A LA COMPRA D. MERCADERÍA
texts.en:
Catherine B. L. (the woman standing in the photo) is 29 years old and has a 7 year old child. She is a member of the Group “Camino Seguro” (Safe Road) that consists of 10 people who live in the Comas District. They are known as a hardworking and responsible group.

Seven years ago, Sra. Catherine started selling groceries at La Frontera Market. She works as a traveling merchant, which was difficult at first. She did not have many clients because the market just recently opened. Despite having days in which she did not sell anything, Sra. Catherine persevered and continued to work with the same level of enthusiasm.

Today she continues to rent a vending stall at the same market, but now business is doing well thanks to her hard work and acquisition of more products. Sra. Catherine is able to pay for her child’s education and the rental fees for her vending stall. She dreams of buying a home so that her family can live comfortably. This loan will be used to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for resale

loans.name: Yovana Melina

texts.es: Yovana tiene dos hijos y vive en la casa de su madre.  Yovana se dedica al rubro del comercio de prendas de vestir para todo tipo de edades, asimismo vende artículos para el hogar como ser (licuadoras, batidoras, y otros) de acuerdo a pedido, es conocida por la actividad que realiza hace bastante tiempo y gracias a los prestamos que obtuvo logro incrementar su capital de trabajo y por ende sus ingresos.  El crédito solicitado en Agrocapital fue para el incremento de su capital de trabajo con lo cual  Yovana invirtió en ropa de cambio de temporada. Yovana trabaja desde hace mucho tiempo con  Agrocapital, es el cuarto crédito al que accedió todos con buen comportamiento en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Yovana has two children and lives in her mother’s house. Yovana sells clothing for all ages as well as items for the home (blenders, mixers, and other items) as they are requested. She is known for the work she’s been doing for a while now and thanks to the loans that she obtained she was able to increase her working capital and consequently her income. The loan that she asked for in Agrocapital is for another increase in working capital with which Yovana invested in clothing for the new season. Yovana has worked with Agrocapital for a long time. This is her fourth loan and she completed all of her previous loans with good behavior in her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase in operating capital

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Madame Astou M.  sollicite pour la premiere fois un prêt de 50 000 frs pour augmenter le fond avec lequel elle gere son activite de de commerce de poissons au marche de Camberene.Elle est mariee et mere d un enfant.ELLE  emprunte  50 000 frs pour augmenter  son fond .Ainsi elle pourra accroitre ses benefices de 25 000 frs chaque mois.Madame Astou M. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit a des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Ms. Astou M. is seeking her first loan of 50,000 francs to increase the capital she uses to run her business selling fish at the market in Camberene. She is married and has one child. She would like to borrow 50,000 francs to increase her capital. In this way, she will be able to increase her profits by 25,000 francs each month. Ms. Astou M. is a beneficiary of the agreement between U-IMCEC (one of Kiva's field partners) and the Program for the Development of Children and Families (PDEF in French) Seydina Issa Laye. The PDEF seeks to reduce poverty within the community, and especially to protect children who come from destitute families. Thanks to this cooperation, the parents of these children can benefit from loans having more flexible terms, as compared to ordinary loans. Since the agreement's inception in December 2008, 120 parents have received financing in amounts varying from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 46 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a business man. She sells crates of drinks at retail prices. She is a hard working woman that is determined to excel in her business. She has been in this business for a long time. She lives in Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more crates of drinks. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks.

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.en:
Nancy M. is a leader of a group of 5 borrowers called In God We Trust. She is 40 years old and married with 2 children aged 25 and 12 years. Her children are in 9th grade and 7th grade, respectively. She is illiterate due to lack of financial support and decided to start a business for a living. Nancy and her family live and work in the VOA community located north of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Nancy is in the business of selling foodstuffs. She buys foodstuffs from wholesalers and sells to residents of VOA. Nancy has been running this business for 12 years and hopes to grow it into a shop in the future. Nancy sells at an affordable price and talks to customers in a good manner in order to encourage customers to continue buying from her.

She started with 1000.00 LRD that was given to her by her brother. Nancy needs this loan to purchase more palm oil, sugar, flour, etc., to improve her business. She dreams of giving her children a better education.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil, sugar, flour, etc., to improve her business

loans.name: Agueda Inès

texts.es: La señorita Agueda Inès X. G.  cuenta con 31 años de edad es soltera ella reside en el lugar conocido como Caserìo Xetinimit, de la Aldea Nimasac, municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala C.A. en la actualidad se dedica en la elaboración de cortes típicos teniendo su pequeño taller propio  donde semanalmente cumple con sus clientes la demanda de la misma por lo que se acerco a las oficinas de la Asociación ASDIR  por un préstamo,  debido a  que necesita implementar su capital de trabajo comprando y obteniendo mejores oportunidades mejorando aun más su trabajo e ingresos mensuales cubriendo así sus necesidades, y ayudando a su familia
texts.en:
Ms. Agueda Inès X. G. is 31 years old. She is single and lives in a place called Caserìo Xetinimit, in the town of Nimasac, city and State of Totonicapán, Guatemala Central America. Currently she does fine weavings, having her own small workshop where weekly she finishes her clients' orders. She is coming to the ASDIR Association offices for a loan, since she needs working capital (money) to buy and create better opportunities improving her work and monthly earnings covering her necessities, and helping her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (Purchase or raw materials)

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is forty-two years old and married. She has given birth to four children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Naomi works hard to help her husband provide for the family.

She is a trader. She sells vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, eggplant, and so on, from a table top at the market square. She buys her goods from nearby communities. Naomi has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure vegetables in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is married and has two children. She has received a junior high education. Mary's husband is a farmer while she sells raw maize at Elmina.  Mary has been in this business since 2008, and it enables her to support her husband in paying the school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize to supply her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to increase her stock of goods.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize

loans.name: United Women Group

texts.en: Korto K.'s business is the sale of rubber materials and food such as seasonings, oils, pepper, etc. She buys her goods from wholesalers and sells retail from a table in the Red Light Market. She has been running this business for more than 25 years and hopes to own a shop in the near future. She is 40 years old and is engaged to be married. Korto has 5 children: the youngest is age 1 year, 7 months and the oldest is 28 years old. Most of her children are in school from 5th grade to freshman university. She also cares for two nephews. Korto started by selling oranges and her working capital when she started was 150.00 Liberian dollars. She speaks well to her customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. Korto needs this loan to purchase more seasonings, salt, rice, etc., to improve her business. She dreams of giving her children a good education in order for them to have a good future. Korto and her family live and work in and around the FDA junction community near the Red Light Market, which is near Monrovia and is the biggest market in Liberia. Korto herself was only able to finish 5th grade due to poverty. Korto is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "United Women". In the photo that accompanies this profile, Korto is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, this non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonings, salt, rice, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Luzelle

texts.en:
Ma. Luzelle O. is from the village of Northern Poblacion, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Luzelle owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of foods in the local community. Ma. Luzelle has been engaged in her business for 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ma. Luzelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Luzelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ma. Luzelle from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Catalina Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Catalina del Socorro C., es profesora de primaria desde hace quince años, en el centro educativo Jesús de Nazareth. Es madre soltera tiene 2 hijo pero ninguno a su cargo.
Actualmente vive en el barrio Abrahán Rugama junto a  una hermana que tiene problemas mentales.
La señora Catalina Chavarria solicito el crédito para para invertirlo en productos que le encargan por catalogo y cubrir otros gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Catalina del Socorro C. has been an elementary school teacher for 15 years at the Jesús de Nazareth educational center. She is a single mother of a two children, neither of whom is under her care. She currently lives in the Abrahán Rugama neighborhood with a sister, who has mental problems. Catalina needs funds to buy products that she sells by catalogue and to cover some other family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay family expenses.

loans.name: Benicio

texts.es: El Sr. Benicio E. es trabajador de la alcaldía municipal su profesión es contador de mercado técnica, en la alcaldía se desempeña como oficial de licitación, es el cuarto crédito con nosotros, el dinero lo solicita para compra de materiales de construcción como piedra piedrín, cemento y mano de obra para hacer un muro del frente de su casa, es casado y tiene un hijo menor a su cargo que está en edad escolar y si los crédito le han ayudado ya que así ha podido sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Mr. Benicio E. is worker at the city hall. His profession is that of technical market accountant. At city hall he works as a bids officer. This is the fourth loan he has had with us. The money he is asking for is to purchase construction materials such as stone, pea stone, cement and to pay labor costs to build a wall in front of his house. He is married and has one minor schoolage child under his care. The loans have helped him since with them he has been able to get his family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stone, pea stone and cement

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 31 years old, single, and takes care of two dependents.  Eric has been in the business of selling charcoal for about 1 year but his original investment as well the profits earned from his business are still too low.  

Eric plans to set up another warehouse containing a large number of sacks of charcoal for sale.  He is therefore requesting a Kiva loan, which he hopes will allow increasing his sales as well as his profits.  With these profits, he will sustain his business and in addition will start building his own house.

loans.use: Buying charcoal in bulk for resale

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
La señora Primitiva H. C., cuenta con 65 años, apenas estudio hasta el nivel de primario, tiene 1 hija. Primitiva vive sola con su hija. La señora Primitiva vive en la zona de Itocta provincia Cercado del Departamento de Cochabamba.

La señora Primitiva se dedica exclusivamente a la producción de leche cruda, toda su producción lechera entrega a un modulo lechero de la zona, que a su vez recoge la empresa PIL ANDINA. 

Las condiciones en las que viven son muy precarias, tienen una casa con habitaciones pequeñas hechas de barro, su ganado se cría en la misma propiedad. La señora Primitiva es una señora muy dedicada a su trabajo, pues ella y su hija se levantan muy temprano todos los días para ordeñar las vacas. Y durante todo el día se dedican a pastear a las vacas, es una actividad ardua donde ambos trabajan.   

La señora Primitiva solicita el crédito para la compra de alimento en general que en la época de invierno este escasea bastante, de esta manera pueda producir más leche, e incrementar  sus ingresos y tener una nivel de vida estable.
texts.en:
Mrs. Primitiva H. C. is 65 years old and has one daughter. She only completed primary school. Primitiva lives with her daughter in the Itocta zone in the province of Cercado in the department of Cochabamba. Primitivia works in raw milk production. She delivers her milk to a local dairy producer who then delivers the milk to Pil Andina. They live in precarious conditions. Their house has small rooms made from clay. Her dairy cows live on the same small property. Mrs. Primitiva is very dedicated to her work. She and her daughter wake up early every day to milk their cows and then during the day they make sure their cows get to graze. This work can be quite arduous for both of them. Primitiva will use the loan money to purchase animal feed because during the winter there is limited food. With feed the cows will produce more milk and thus increase her earnings and let her have a more stable life.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed for dairy cows

loans.name: Maria's Group

texts.en:
Maria B. is from the village of Caritan Norte, Tuguegarao City. She is 45 years old. Maria is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Maria is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Maria owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Maria has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Maria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Maria is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Maria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Saltanata's Group

texts.en:
Saltanata Z. is the leader of her group. She is 33 and married.  She has two sons and a daughter. Saltanata works in a sewing workshop in Bishkek and her brother takes care of her younger son during the day while her other children are at school.  Ten years ago, with the initial investment of 1000 soms ($21.83), her husband began to cultivate strawberries to sell. In this way he makes 6,000 soms ($131) a month. This made it possible for them to buy a one-room flat. Now they want to get a loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, Saltanata dreams of buying a big house.

Kairkul A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 39 and married. She works as a retail packager and her husband is a private driver. Kairkul has two daughters; both of them study at school. Six years ago, Kairkul's relatives advised her to cultivate strawberries. Thus with the initial amount of 2,000 soms ($43.66) she began her business. Now in this way, Kairkul makes 8,000 soms ($174.67) a month. She needs a loan to purchase fertilizer.  

Gulsara A. is 39 and married. She has two daughters and a son. Her daughters study at school and her son is preschool age. The grandmother takes care of him when nobody is at home.  Gulsara cultivates strawberries and she wants to get a loan to purchase fuel and fertilizer.

Keldibek K. is 44 and married. He works as a taxi driver. He has two daughters; both of them are preschool age. Therefore, Keldibek's wife sits at home and takes care of them. In order to make money, Keldibek and his wife cultivate strawberries. In this way they make an additional 8,000 soms ($174.67) a month. Keldibek wants to get a loan to purchase fertilizer, which is needed for cultivation. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 34-year old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and he is the main income provider for his family with his business.
 For the past few years, he has made his living as a professional taxi driver. He operates transportation services for customers in his village as well as neighboring towns. With his Kiva loan requested of US $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will be able to perform maintenance work on his vehicle. He reports that these improvements will enable him to provide his service to more passengers.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his car

loans.name: Kijongobya Tweyambe Group, Mubende

texts.en:
With hard work and high self-esteem, K. Merab, aged 50 years, has effectively maintained her retail shop for the last ten years. She has mostly been selling rice and other small domestic items that are regularly used in homes.

Merab began this business with the little capital that she had saved from her farming business. For this married mother of seven, things have not always been easy but she has relied on not only her hard work but also support from friends to withstand the challenges.

In a week, Merab makes 100,000 shillings or more, depending on many factors. With this loan, she is keen on purchasing more retail items such as rice, sugar, salt and soap.

Merab is the lady with a green veil wrapped around her head and she belongs to a group of other members who insure and hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as sugar and soap

loans.name: Letisia

texts.en: Letisia T. is 39 and married with four children. She owns a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Letisia needs a loan of WST 1,750 to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or approximately USD 233 per week) to improve and expand her business. In 2008, Letisia joined SPBD and this is her 3rd loan. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice F. is from the village of Gappal, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 26 years old. Alice is married and has 3 very young children. To make a living, Alice owns & operates a fruit and vegetable vending business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fruits and vegetables in the community. Alice has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alice joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alice is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Alice from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.en: K. Abdumanon is a diligent and tenacious farmer who strives to meet his family’s needs. He is widower, and thus he carries the burden alone through his farming income to meet his family’s needs. Abdumanon works on a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm owned by his parents. His harvests are sometimes not maximized because his cultivation method and seeds are not the best. Better farming supplies, seeds and fertilizer require a larger capital, which he didn’t have. Abdumanon is now relieved that IMON International is helping him obtain the loan he needs to improve his farming. This loan will be used to buy superior seeds, organic fertilizers, and pesticides. He is waiting for his next harvest, which he hopes will yield better results than his previous harvests. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase superior seeds, organic fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Before opening a clothing stand at a city market, Alina A. had worked as a saleswoman for many years. Alina is trading in clothing for teenagers and young women. Currently, Alina is single and living with her extended family, but dreaming of expanding her business and owning her own living place one day. 

To revamp her clothing stock before the upcoming busy autumn season, Alina has applied for this loan.

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing stock

loans.name: Mujeres De Maiz Group

texts.es: Doña Reina V., es casada, D. cuarenta y cuatro años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. asistir a la escuela, tiene ocho hijos, dos mayores D. edad y seis menores a quienes ella tiene que cubrir todos los gastos ya que hace ocho años se separaron con su esposo y ella lucha para salir adelante con sus hijos, se dedica a la artesanía (Confección D. Pants y Sudaderos), cuenta con 24 años D. experiencia en ésta actividad. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos D. superación y la ayuda D. unas sobrinas y vecinas  organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina MUJERES D. MAÍZ, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes y porque tiene relación con la cosecha del lugar. El grupo cuenta con 10 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar; la crianza D. animales, confección D. ropas deportivas y  venta D. ropas típicas.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra D. tela, y D. esa forma incrementar su negocio y así generar más ganancias. Ya que ella considera que existe demanda pero por falta del capital, no ha podido cubrir estos pedidos, pero ha salido adelante con ayuda D. créditos y espera que su negocio sea más granD. y pueda genere más ingresos para su desarrollo personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Reina V. is 44 years old and married. She didn't have the opportunity to go to school. She has 8 children; 2 are grown up and independent, but the other 6 are dependent on her. Reina has been separated from her husband for 8 years and struggles to proviD. for her children. She makes handmaD. artisan crafts (pants and saddle blankets). She has 24 years of experience with this kind of work. With enthusiasm and the desire to improve her life, as well as the help of her nieces and neighbors, Reina is organizing this group to request a loan. The community bank is called MUJERES D. MAÍZ (Women of Maize), a name chosen by the members because it refers to the local harvest. The group consists of 10 women who work in various activities such as raising livestock, making athletic clothing, and clothing sales. Reina will use the loan to buy fabric, which will increase her business and thus generate additional income. There is demand for her work but Reina hasn't been able to meet this demand due to lack of capital. With financing, she hopes to see her business grow and generate more income for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sergio Alberto

texts.es:
Sergio de 30 años de edad, vive en Concepción Batres del departamento de Usulután, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 2 y 1 año de edad, el se dedica al enderezado y pintura de vehículos en su propio taller, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 5 años y lo aprendió por que trabajaba en otros talleres, el realiza sus trabajos con dos empleados que le ayudan, él tiene la dificultad de no contar con capital para invertir en repuestos y herramientas para el trabajo.
Él solicita de un préstamo para la compra de las herramientas necesarias para desarrollar su trabajo, con esta inversión el estará preparado para atender las demandas de sus clientes y darles un mejor servicio.
Las aspiraciones de Sergio son contar con las herramientas para realizar su trabajo, brindar un mejor servicio, ampliar su negocio y darle estabilidad; mejorar las condiciones de su familia y que estos cuenten con lo necesario para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Sergio is 30 years old and resides in Concepción Batres in the Department of Usulután. He lives with his wife and two children (ages 2 and 1). Sergio performs auto paint and body work in his own shop. He has owned his business for five years and learned this job while working at other repair shops. At his business, Sergio has two employees who help him. He has had difficulty acquiring the capital to invest in the parts and tools he needs for his work.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy the necessary tools to perform his job. With this investment, Sergio will be prepared to meet the demands of his customers and provide them better service. His aspirations include having the necessary equipment for his work, providing better service, expanding and stabilizing his business, and improving his family’s conditions so that they will have everything they need to develop.

loans.use: Purchase tools

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn D. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 44 years old, widowed, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a recycling services business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling junk and other waste material to local businesses and community members. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Korn

texts.en: Korn S., 43, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. is a police officer, earning an income of USD 2.6 per day. Her husband sells palm fruit and juice, earning an income of USD 4 per day. S. has to spend 80 USD on food and 19  USD on other necessary expenses every month.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to repair her house.

loans.use: repair the house

loans.name: Abundia

texts.en:
Abundia S. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 47 years old. Abundia is married and has 5 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Abundia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits and vegetables like bananas. Abundia works hard to provide the needs of her household.

Abundia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Abundia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.  Abundia is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Jessica Rudy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jessica Rudy; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es divorciada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia se dedica a trabajar como abogada, la socia es asesora legal en el municipio de chinchero, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar en el trabajo. La socia solicita el préstamo para la mantención de su casa.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank 'Progreso' (Progress), which is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province and Cusco department.

Jessica Rudy is 34 years old, is divoerced and has 1 son. She works as a lawyer, and is a legal assessor in the Chinchero Council. She works from 8am until 6pm, and wants to improve in her job. Jessica is seeking a loan to maintain her home.

Jessica thanks those who form part of this dream by this method and promises to meet her repayments within the established time.

loans.use: Home maintenance

loans.name: Aparicio

texts.es: Aparicio, de 54 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa Martha de 46 años, que es comerciante, y de sus 5 hijos, los cuales son mayores y trabajan; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde muy joven este trabajador hombre aprendió a elaborar bijouteria (collares, aretes, pulseras) de diversa pedrería; y cuando tuvo que sacar adelante a su familia no dudo en seguir con este trabajo. En la actualidad produce, al por mayor, toda clase de bijouteria y la comercializa por pedidos a los grandes emporios de la ciudad. Esta muy satisfecho pues obtiene regulares ganancias que le han permitido sacar a su familia adelante; además la labor es tranquila pues la realiza en su casa de lunes a viernes, durante la mañana y en la tarde. Trabaja solo, ya que el resto de su familia se dedica a otras labores; y entrega la mercadería una vez a la semana; pero como es un hombre trabajador tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de aumentar la cantidad de mercadería que comercializa para mejorar sus ganancias. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Aparicio tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en pedrería para cumplir con un pedido que tiene pendiente, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Aparicio is 54 years old.  He lives in his own home together with his wife, 46 year-old Martha who is a saleswoman, and their five children.  Their children are all grown up and work.  Together they all work hard every day to get ahead in life. From a young age, this hard-working man learned to make jewelry (necklaces, earrings, bracelets) from different precious stones.  When he had to support his family, he didn't hesitate to continue with this work.  He currently produces all kinds of jewelry wholesale and he sells, to order, to the large stores in the city. 

Aparicio is very satisfied because he makes regular profits which have allowed him to get his family ahead.  In addition, the work is relaxed since he does it from Monday to Friday, in the mornings and afternoons.  He works alone, since the rest of his family work in other jobs, and he delivers his goods once a week.  However, as he is a hard-working man, he has many plans for the future such as increasing the quantity of goods that he sells in order to improve his profits.

This is the first loan that Aparicio has had from MFP and he pledges to make his repayments on time as he doesn't want to disappoint the people who made this support possible since it will allow him to continue working in search of progress.  Aparicio is planning to invest the loan in buying merchandise, in buying precious stones so that he can fill an order that he has pending.  In this way he hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy precious stones so that he can fill orders from his customers

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity S. is 34 years old and married to a builder. She has three children, who all go to school. Charity is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in a small restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs such as raw meat, rice, beans etc. to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bar.

loans.use: To stock more foodstuffs such as raw meat, rice, beans etc.

loans.name: Bertalina Del Rosario

texts.es: Bertalina Del Rosario tiene 42 años, su actividad es la venta de comida hace mas 8 años que tiene este negocio. Es una mujer muy emprendedora y disfruta de ofrecerles a sus clientes una buena calidad de comida, inicio este medio de vida por sus tías que le enseñaron a cocinar los deliciosos platillos que ofrece a su público en general. Ella se levanta temprano desde las 6 de la mañana para realizar las compras de sus frutas y verduras necesarias para la elaboración de sus platillos. El financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, verduras, granos básicos entre otros.
texts.en: Bertalina Del Rosario is 42 years old.  Her business activity is selling meals.  She has had her business for more than 8 years.  She is a very enterprising woman and she enjoys offering her customers good quality food.  She started this business thanks to her aunts who taught her to cook the delicious dishes that she offers to her customers.  She gets up early, at 6.00am, to shop for the fruit and vegetables that she needs to make her meals.  She will use her loan to buy basic grains, vegetables, etc.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Señor Nazareno Group

texts.es: Hedibia es una de las 8 socias de la alcancía Comunal  “Señor Nazareno “. Es  casada y a sus 50 años de edad tiene dos menores hijos dependientes de ella y de su conyugue. Se dedica a la venta de  frutas, bebidas gaseosas y confitería aledañamente a la zona donde reside y como ambulante ofrece sus productos en lo peajes donde transitan muchos camiones  de carga pesada  que viajan al centro del país. Esta actividad es emprendida desde niña pues los pobladores de la zona aprovechan la oportunidad de tener  una zona  transitada por muchos vehículos incluso para hacer turismo interno en nuestro país como nos manifiesta Hedibia  su finalidad es obtener ganancias de sus ventas para educar a sus hijos menores. Hasta ahora a logrado mejorar su vivienda y sueña con ahorrar para comprar un auto y ponerlo a trabajar en transporte público de pasajeros. Podemos apreciar a 6 de los integrantes en plena reunión de desembolso, lamentablemente el acceso a su anexo de Corcona le dificultó la llegada a tiempo de  Rolando y Madeleyne por lo cual se están publicando sus fotografías adjunta a la del grupo. Todos están integrados en el sistema de Prosperidad y son personas responsables,  orgullosas de sus negocios y quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Hedibia is one of the 8 members of the “Señor Nazareno" Communal Bank. She is married and at the age of 50 has two young children who depend on her and her husband. She sells fruit, pop and snacks on the streets around the zone where she lives. She offers her products at the toll gates where many heavy cargo trucks pass through on their way to the center of the country. She learned this business as a child, as the citizens of the area take advantage of the opportunities inherent in living in an area with a lot of traffic, including tourist traffic. Hedibia's goal is to make an income from her sales to educate her children.

In the photo, we can see 6 of the members in the payment meeting. Unfortunately, the difficulty in getting to Corcona meant that Rolando and Madeleyne were not able to arrive on time, so we are putting their photos next to the group. All of the members in the Prosperidad system are responsible people who are proud of their businesses and want to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, pop, snacks (peanuts, beans), and plantain chips.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia Y. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 58 years old. Cecelia is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Cecelia owns & operates a specialized retail store selling coconut wine known as "tuba" in the local community. Cecelia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Cecelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Cecelia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase (tuba) and make her motorcycle monthly payment. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Cecelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase native wine (tuba) and make motorcycle payments

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a young man from Rafah in Gaza Strip. Ahmed sells mobile phone accessories in his two-year-old shop. He sells phone covers, replaces broken screens, etc.

Ahmed wants to expand his business. He wants to include more services such as fixing phones. He took a loan from FATEN to purchase a wider variety and to be able to hire someone and buy tools to work on fixing phones.

Ahmed appears in the picture here in his store.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone accessories to sell in the store

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda, tiene 31 años de edad y tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de San Miguel de la provincia de la Convención y vive en la ciudad de Urubamba. Hilda se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía en la empresa LANANDINA. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Hilda en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para ahorrar. 

Hilda pertenece al banco comunal “Mainique” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Hilda is 31 years old and has two children.  She was born in the city of San Miguel, in the province of La Convención, but lives in the city of Urubamba.  Hilda makes handicrafts for the LANANDINA company.  She has been working at this job for 10 years and has been successful at it thanks to her hard work.  Hilda is in need of a loan to make personal purchases and put away savings.

She is a member of the "Mainique" communal bank which belongs to the Arariwa Association.  She is grateful for this opportunity and is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To make personal purchases and put away savings
